Reviews.Title: Resolution not great
Reviews.Author: abjeffers
Reviews.Content: Purchased surveillance system after front lawn was trashed by some idiot doing donuts.  It was easy to set up, and initially looked pretty good.  Guy showed up again two days later.  Even in daylight, from 30 feet away, camera resolution is so poor, can't read a license plate.  Keep looking; probably better to spend a little more money for a better system.

Reviews.Title: The product works, but...
Reviews.Author: Raf "Lacocacolaman"
Reviews.Content: The good1. It works great. By great I haven't had a problem, it gives me the video and records fine2.The interface is somewhat easy if you're savvy and read what you click. I could imagine my mother never figuring it out but for me I have no problem maneuvering through it without a manual.3. The price is great considering you're getting 8 cameras4. Although I haven't needed tech support, people review tech support is great.5. Works great through the homenetwork. I get a live feed on all my devices, Android phone, and ipad.----------------------------------------------The Bad (Which is more of a personal problem and WARNING to buyers)1. The quality!Ugh, it's so poor. sure you can tell who your mother, father, and brothers are when they walk into the shot but when it's a stranger good luck.If you're buying this to monitor employees such as nannies, pool guy, or whoever it's fine.But if a stranger walks into the shot good luck ever figuring out who it is. It's my biggest regret because I bought this for home security. If a group of men robbed my house and I handed the footage to the police it would be utterlessly pointless. They would need to hire a scientific forensic team to make out peoples faces or details. Realistically they would only do that for a murder.If you want this for home security don't be cheap with it. We're living in  the 21st century! lets act like it. Pay twice as much for the 1080p or 720p cameras. I completely tossed my money down the drain with this set up. Although I do love the interface and everything the quality just does not cut it and like I said it's a personal problem but a serious one if you want this to see who's breaking into cars or who's ruining your daisies or breaking your mail box.The point of the security camera is for you to see who's doing the naughty things. Pay double for the 720p or 1080p you won't regret it.  You NEED GOOD QUALITY IMAGES.I Hope I save someone money with my post. I was fooled by all the happy and great reviews. Also I was a total noob but I learned my lesson too bad it cost nearly 400$

Reviews.Title: Dont spend the premium expecting a quality system
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: At the time that I purchased this system (april 2012) it had an almost 800 dollar price tag from amazon. I assumed paying more meant I would get higher quality cameras and more importantly higher quality software. Having previously owned an SVAT 4 camera setup which was less than half as much it left much to desire in a security setup. I will start with the pros of this system.Pros- It supports audio monitoring- They have an android app (albeit buggy)- The video quality is decent enough to make out a face if the cameras are positioned properlyCons- The finish on the cameras is awful. They started oxidizing/fading and turning gold in the Arizona sun 2 WEEKS after install- The screws that come with it are trash (the heads literally snap right off under low torque)- Forget about getting the mobile/web browser app to work if you have an app (details below)I work in IT/Networking for a living and am very technically savvy. I attempted to use multiple routers with every possible setting (UPNP/Firewall/DMZ/flashing different firmware/static routing/e.t.c.)I eventually gave in and connected a switch behind the cable modem + paid a monthly premium for a second IP address for the DVR and moblie viewing still was not functioning. When I called their technical support (outsourced to india) I spoke to a representative about the situation who kept stating "sir you have to forward the correct ports in your router" I had to argue with her that that was irrelevant because the DVR was not behind a router and the interface was connected directly to the ISPs WAN. After 15 minutes of arguing I requested to speak with a higher tier of support. I was transferred to a supervisor who was polite and said he would email me instructions to update the firmware on the DVR to see if that solved the issue. I never received the email even though I verbally confirmed my email address (Yes I checked my spam filter). I had to call back again and request the link to download new firmware. This time I received the email so I had to run out to the store to buy a usb flash drive. The firmware update went smoothly (yay! one thing went right) and after trying a few different ports I was able to get mobile view working on both the web browser and android.- One of the cameras died after 6 months- The web viewer does not work with windows 8 no matter what browser/security settings you tryWith its current amazon price (just over 500) I can say you get what you pay for. If you are looking at a quality setup then look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: Works Perfectly...but does require some skill!
Reviews.Author: C. T. Whaley
Reviews.Content: I purchased this system on a lightning deal a week ago and I am so impressed with it.The install was easy in the attic (to do it right you will have to have a basic knowledge of running wires, drilling holes, mounting objects, etc.).The thing I want to review primarily is the networking and camera access on your smartphone and other devices.Does it work? - YES!! I am currently several miles from home and able to watch my home security on my phone, tablet, and laptop.Was it easy to set up? No...and yes.  You have to have a working knowledge of networks (running cat5e cable, routers, ip addresses, DNS (very important), and port forwarding).I knew how to do most of this stuff, but it took several calls to support (which they quickly answered and solved my problems) and some time googling my issues. That being said, I could now set up another system for networking in about 30 mins.IMPORTANT - you will probably need to call them to update the firmware on the DVR. Mine was outdated, and even with a network connection I was not able to discover this or update until I spoke with a tech rep.My family and friends are all very impressed with this setup.I definitely recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Good System, but Mobile Access Security is Lacking
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: Pros:-Great system for the price-Easy to setup - Plug and play for the basic need. It starts recording as soon as a signal is provided.-Total power used during my initial test was 36WCons:-Maximum password is 6 characters which is also used for mobile connection. Passwords this short can be susceptible to a brute force hack within a couple days. Therefore, I needed to setup a VPN in order to feel safe serving the video on the network.-Colors are a little muted-TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SUPPORT:I messaged technical support due to a intermittent IR LED problem. 5 days later, they advised me to replace the cable. I replaced the cable, problem persisted, so I emailed back. another week later, they gave me a link to request service. I filled out the form and stated that I tried replacing the cable. A couple days later, I was accused of using poor quality cable when I used the same cable that came in the kit. Eventually, I was given an RMA number.

Reviews.Title: Love the swann system
Reviews.Author: Chipawa "honestindian"
Reviews.Content: for the price and the quality you cannot beat it. Night vision is great as well. I never have to get up and see who is at the door anymore. Stupid sales people drive you nuts and refuse to take no for an answer.

Reviews.Title: A Decent system...
Reviews.Author: D. Mattow
Reviews.Content: I'll keep this short...VERY Easy Setup with the hardest thing being to run the wires. Plug in the DVR, then plug in the cameras and voila. Simple menus to setup. Has RCA Video out along with VGA out. Only thing I don't like is the video quality where anything over 15 feet will make it hard for you to distinguish a face. But that's about it.

Reviews.Title: no problems
Reviews.Author: handydave
Reviews.Content: This is a sweet system, as with any camera systems there is some trial and error getting your cameras all set up to cover the areas you desire, but once it's up and running it is nice.Would recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: android??extension cables a joke
Reviews.Author: jman
Reviews.Content: I got system hooked up one camera, then downloaded android software followed step by step instructions cant get this thing to work n customer support doesnt have a clue!, beware dont by the bnc extension cables because they dont come with proper connections!...honestly buy another system you will be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: Look elsewhere, the reviews are overhyped !
Reviews.Author: K S "raptorsrock19"
Reviews.Content: This unit is an overpriced, outdated, piece of junk. The picture quality is horrible ! Save your money and keep looking.*Update I just had a camera go out last night. Luckily I was only using 6 out of the 8 that came with it. This set is garbage ! There is no reason I should have had a camera die on me already.;

Reviews.Title: Up and running
Reviews.Author: SPFDRum
Reviews.Content: OK, I will admit, I ordered the wired cameras and have a finished house; so lets just say it was some work to get the system  installed, but well worth it.  Fortunately, having done lots of electrical/low voltage work, I have the tools and some short cuts that helped...Now getting the cameras on the internet where a bit more difficult.  If you don't want to do a domain name, get a static IP.  But know you will need both, your routers address IP for local wireless viewing and the static for remote viewing on either your smart phone or computer.  That was kicking my butt, I will admit.  So what do you do? Call tech support, of course.Now while researching this, I did notice some issues with tech support.  I did NOT experience any of that.  I called, and after following the menu, I was number 2 in the que.  Within 5 minutes, I was talking to a tech rep and with in 15 minute, every issue I had was solved.  They even followed up with an email detailing all the steps and updates we did, that are required, and may be needed.  You really can't ask for more.If there was a 1/2 star, I would rate 4 1/2, the only reason, some of the documentation is sketch or I just couldn't find what I was looking for.....Overall, if you are looking, this system will do you very well.

Reviews.Title: If only all products were this well done...
Reviews.Author: M.F. Ainslie
Reviews.Content: I bought this based on excellent reviews after our house was burgled in August 2012 while we were on vacation; we live in a not-so-great area of Philadelphia.  I'm not given to exaggeration, but in fact it's no exaggeration to say that this company seems to be firing on all cylinders.  The product was well made, reasonably priced and promptly shipped.  Many electronics companies seem to do that while skimping on the writers and proofreaders of the manual and/or customer service.  Not this one.  The manual is notable for its clarity and accuracy, and when I called customer service because I couldn't get a mouse-controlled pointer on the screen, I got a real person after pressing only a single button for Customer Service.  He came on the line promptly and seemed to be well trained; right away, he knew what I needed to do and told me.Since I've been dealing with installing the cameras (and let me tell you, it's not easy running the wires in a 113-year-old stone mansion) I haven't gone through all the programming of the DVR, except the date and time, but so far it seems to be very straightforward.  A bonus I hadn't known about beforehand (which would only have made my purchase all the more likely) is the ability to program the motion sensors to detect motion only on part of the screen.  We live on an intersection, so the ability to tell the system not to bother me if the motion is only a passing car is huge.Philadelphia now has a program by which you can register your security cameras with the police, so they might be able to catch other criminals more easily, too.  I'm hoping this system I bought will really help clean up our neighborhood and improve property values.  For certain I'll be recommending this Swann system to my friends and neighbors.  One suggestion to Swann for this kind of thing-- something that automatically recognizes and records license plates might be helpful.  (Far be it from me to encourage Big Brother, but as long as the cameras are controlled by private citizens I think that's much less likely.)

Reviews.Title: Everything you need, in a clean package.
Reviews.Author: 04 RSX
Reviews.Content: I bought this 4 camera set up for my own home, and it is perfect for the application.The most intelligent feature is that the wires for the cameras go up through the mount of the camera. This is important for three reasons, one, it allows a very clean installation when all is said and done. Two, it means the only way someone could disable the camera would be to rip the entire unit from wherever you have it mounted. And finally, you don't have to worry about any openings in your roof or ceiling that would allow critters to crawl into your home or allow heat/ac to escape.The video quality is great for the price. Day time viewing is as good as it gets. Night time viewing is black and white but still relatively clear. The frame rate is great as well. The dvr is easy to set up but you will need a monitor to view your set up in real time. A normal computer monitor works fine. 60 feet of cord is more than enough for my 1500 sq foot house. I have absolutely no complaints about the quality or price of this item. The features are fantastic.

Reviews.Title: Expectations exceeded
Reviews.Author: J. Cantrell
Reviews.Content: My Swann SWDVK 825508 8-Channel Digital Video Recorder with Smartphone Viewing and 8 x PRO-550 Cameras arrived Wed. afternoon. On Thursday morning I plugged in the DVR, connected it to a TV, plugged in two cameras and Presto! It worked right out of the box. Next issue-updating the firmware for the DVR. It doesn't get much easier than this friends, other reviews stated the system was not compatible with Mac's and Safari; au contraire Watson, I phoned Swann customer service, 3 minutes later a tech took control of my MacBook Air, downloaded the firmware to a flash drive which I used to update the DVR and that phase was complete. I have a large home and had anticipated the need for extension video cables which was necessary. The (4) 150ft extenders available on Amazon were great but you need to purchase BNC female to female coupler adapters to work with the Swann cables. Radio Shack has them. My installation guys completed the cabling by Thursday afternoon and I was fully operational when they left. I have 4 cameras installed and they work flawlessly. The infrared is just terrific at night. The DVR is so easy to operate, search for footage by movement tags is simple and efficient. This system is way better than I expected for the money. Friday morning I phoned Swann Support to setup remote access-IT DOESN'T GET ANY EASIER THAN THIS. The tech took control of my computer, accessed my router, downloaded firmware updates to the Netgear router, configured it, walked me though the DVR configuration and in 5-7 minutes I had remote access on my laptop and the IP address for my iPhone once I download the App for phone viewing.  I don't understand the negative reviews on Swann Support; my experience with them rates a 10 in every way. I'm off to Hawaii tomorrow and can monitor my home inside and out from 3000 miles away.  I purchase a lot of things online and this Swann System is everything I could have hoped for. The cameras are not HD, but the images are crisp, in color and amazingly clear in infrared. I'm guessing do-it-yourselfers can do the cabling themselves if they have the time, the system setup is very simple. The hard part is deciding where to place the cameras and how you're going to string video and power cable to those locations. I highly recommend this system to anyone whether they need security surveillance, monitoring of elderly parents or young children or keeping track of your dogs and cats.Update: The remote monitoring works perfectly. On vacation and able to view live footage from all cameras on my laptop. Playback of individual or all cameras hour by hour. This is pretty sweet.

Reviews.Title: Swann DVR
Reviews.Author: Kristin Green
Reviews.Content: fast shipping (amazon prime). I love the Swann DVR it works perfectly. I can see whats happening at my house from anywhere I'm at via internet and smart phone. Easy to install and set up, with easy to use OS.

Reviews.Title: Great system!
Reviews.Author: Deborah Price "Artlady"
Reviews.Content: This system met our needs perfectly.  It really exceeded our expectations.  It comes with four cameras which cover a large viewing area.  You can monitor all camera views at once or individually.  It can be set to start recording when it detects motion.  That is a wonderful feature to keep from recording endless hours of nothingness!  This was exactly what we were looking for and then some!  It is very reasonably priced and is excellent quality.  The pictures are very clear and the colors are great.  Wish we had bought it sooner.

Reviews.Title: Good equipment at a fair price
Reviews.Author: W. Crumes
Reviews.Content: The cameras and dvr seem to do a good job,  I wish the cables had been than 60 ft, Perhaps 75 ft to 80 ft.

Reviews.Title: Good Value and works fine.
Reviews.Author: A. Liu
Reviews.Content: I received my Swann system last night and was able to test out all major functions without actually installing the cameras in the walls.Video quality is not very good but good enough to monitor activities around the house. The reason I bought the camera system is someone let his/her dog used my front lawn as a toilet and I have to clean up the dog sxxt a few times already in the past two weeks. I'll install the camera monitoring my front lawn all day. I hope the Swann will catch the bad person or if not at least deter him/her from doing it again. I use a Motorola Surfboard 6580 cable modem and after enabling UPNP, I was able to use my cell phone and laptop to monitor the video over the Internet. When connecting thru the Internet, make sure you use the external public IP address (ie. 67.178.34.59) for the router and not the internal private IP address (ie. 192.168.0.1) and use the video PORT (ie. 9000) when using the netviewer software from the CD or use the mobile app PORT (ie. 18004) when using the cell phone app. My Motorola cable modem happens to support UPNP so there is really no configuration needed in the cable modem except making sure UPNP is enabled. And make sure you configure the device name, user id and password before you try the remote viewing thru the Internet.Overall the camera system works fine and price is good. One last thing, the Android app does not work in Honeycomb tablets. I got force closed each time starting the app in my tablet.

Reviews.Title: Horrible!
Reviews.Author: stan marshall
Reviews.Content: Too bad there is not a "no star" rating. What makes this system so bad is the mounting bracket and the way you position the camera. Who ever thought this was a good idea should be dragged in the street and beaten. Instead of using the ball and swivel, they have this stupid two brackets that adjust by loosening two tiny set screws. So your on a ladder trying to position the camera just right while trying to loosen and tighten these tiny screws. The way the bracket mounts is also horrible. The cable goes through this bracket and under the mount ring that you screw to the wall. They sell it as a feature, but once again your on the ladder and instead of taking the mount ring up and attaching it to the wall, you have to take the whole camera with cable and dangle and balance it with the drill to mount it. This is the third time I have mounted camera systems to my house and cannot believe this system. The night vision is also the worst I have seen. If I had not waited so long to put this system up I would have returned it. AVOID.

Reviews.Title: BAD PRODUCT,POOR SERVICE AND A BAD COMPANY
Reviews.Author: GILMER SMITH JR
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product thur Amazon. It was listed as 4 PRO550 cameras. When it arrived it was 4 PRO530 cameras with a card stating it was a free upgrade.  2  of the cameras did not work.  I contacted SWANN and was told to return the 2 cameras and I would recieve replacements. Next I recieved an email from SWANN that my proof of purchase was not with the cameras to mail or fax THE PROOF OF PURCHASE or SWANN would return the cameras to me in their original condition at their convience.  I faxed the POF to save time. Now SWANN says they have not recieved the fax.  The system was shipped from SWANN, they don't even know if they shipped it or when.\  Now I am waiting for SWANN to return the cameras to me at their convience, so I can return them thur AMAZON.  Purchase at your own risk.

Reviews.Title: Acceptable, but not great
Reviews.Author: Paul Crowley "P Crowley"
Reviews.Content: This is a small business/home camera system - certainly nothing more than that.  It comes with everything you need, except maybe a longer cable for a camera or two depending on your configuration.  We had someone do the camera wiring to avoid crawling around in an attic, and even at that it was a pretty small investment.Will it help identify a burgler or vandal?  Yes.The bad news, however is pretty bad.Camera resolution is not great, even with the upgraded cameras.  The system comes advertised as being able to record in D1 format, but every indication is that even with the system set to record at D1 all you get really is CIF - 320x240.  You aren't going to be able to see a tattoo on an arm like that, so if that is what you are hoping for to id your bad guy ... well, this isn't the system for that job.  Maybe one with real D1 resolution would help.Notifications via email work and are easy to set up... except for the fact that you get the email as long as an hour after the event.  It sends you a single still frame and all the nifty apps for Android and iPhone/iPad WILL NOT PLAY BACK RECORDED VIDEO.  This means that you need to connect a real computer to your network (if that is even possible remotely) to view what really happened.  This lack of being able to access recorded video via remote applications is a serious flaw.The notifications coming so late after the fact is also a serious problem with the system.  While it is nice to get a picture emailed to you, having it come long after the fact - as much as an hour, but usually about 40 minutes - makes it almost pointless.Swann has technical support.  Unfortunately, they cater their support to folks that take the parts out of the box, never read the instructions, and then call for help when they can't figure it out.  So their support people are good at leading you through the menus and telling folks they actually do need to connect both wires for the camera to work.  Anything like a real technical question - like how you can get the notifications in a timely manner - and they are completely stumped.  I do have to give Swann credit for the support they are offering - considering the wait times for phone support there must be a lot of people calling that can't read the instructions.  The manuals are quite good considering what is common with consumer electronics today.  No Engrish here.Setting up the motion detection for notifications and recording can be somewhat of a pain also.  It takes patience and an understanding of what is going on with the cameras.  Also, any outdoor camera is going to be subject to insects, birds and bats flying by and triggering recording.  Also you need to be aware of things like a nearby roadway where headlights shine on the building, air conditioner fans rotating and such like that.  Also, outdoor cameras require regular cleaning of things like spiderwebs.The cleaning aspect of the cameras was somewhat of a surprise to me.  I had a neighbor that had cameras put on their 2nd story eaves - how are you going to clean those cameras off?Final hint on camera placement is something I picked up.  High camera placement is the norm and people expect that.  So they wear hats and don't look up.  Have a camera low down looking up or at eye level to defeat this and actually catch a face that can be recognized.  Just your camera placement alone will let potential bad guys know you are serious.So is this Swann unit any good?  Sure, just don't expect too much.  Could it be better?  Absolutely - the hardware is all there it just needs some software help.

Reviews.Title: I just dont get it?
Reviews.Author: jack
Reviews.Content: I thought the main reason for a camera security system was to identify a burglar? You could be standing 10ft away staring straight into the cam and not have to worry about someone identifying you. I have the resolution maxed out. I have a 5yr old flip phone in my closet that has far better video quality(uncompilable actually). Then if that wasnt bad enough try going back and looking at what was recorded!!!! Its even more degraded:( It reminds me of the early days of youtube when everyone was using 240p cameras and you couldn't distinguish a car from a potato (blocky and distorted). You don't need a high FPS just good quality per frame, even if it was only 2 FPS with good quality I would have giving 5 stars. I give it 3 stars because upgraded cameras can be bought, it works, was easy to setup/use, and the night vision works surprisingly well. Buy extra cable unless you trying to secure a small garage or shop.

Reviews.Title: After a year of use
Reviews.Author: Bart "bart"
Reviews.Content: After having this for a year the cameras are slowing dying out from what it seems like the night mode stopped working cant see anything on two of the cameras. I guess thats what you get for this price

Reviews.Title: Good quality at a great price
Reviews.Author: Ian Cole
Reviews.Content: Writing this review to help out others who may have been stuck waffling around in amateur-home-security-system limbo, trying to get a system together.I started with a PC-based Foscam setup, 3 FI8910W running off of my laptop. Good (not great) picture quality, slow framerate, remotely accessible, fine.Moved to 4 Cybernova wireless 720P cameras, picture quality was better, but framerate still slow, and computer working overtime.Switched to Ubiquiti AirCam and Mini, AirCam was good quality but couldn't get remote access set up.I ended up giving up on PC-based setup and moving to this DVR kit and have been well pleased. The fact that a dedicated DVR unit is handling the video through a corded feed means that the wireless bandwidth and processing power limitations are no longer a factor. I have it set up for viewing via PC, Android, and on my main television set. Video is extremely smooth, and I would say the quality from the included PRO-530 cameras (thanks for the upgrade!) is comparable to the Foscam 8910s, however much, much smoother. I am trying out an Evertech 700 TVL Cameraa to see if I can step up video quality a couple of notches, but other than that, I am very pleased.This is a far superior option to PC-based security camera setups. Definitely go for it.

Reviews.Title: Quality not good - playback of recordings usually stops partway through
Reviews.Author: Mary Ann Crum
Reviews.Content: This dvr will play live video OK, but the recordings are another story.  It does record, but some of the recordings will play all the way through, and about half won't.  They will play to a certain point and then playback will halt.  The one I'm looking at right now was from 10:39:47 AM until 10:46:15 AM today.  It plays until 10:40:44 and stops.  The blue progress bar stops first, as if the DVR is unable to read the entire recording from the disk, then the playback stops at when it hits the end of the progress bar.  The software is not up to par. (I'm a software developer so I can tell)  It's possible that the hard drive has problems, but I doubt it because it's very consistent and never displays any error messages.  It consistently shows the live video, and makes recordings when it should, but it fails on playback about half of the time.  Buy something else.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: David Ervin
Reviews.Content: I installed this about a month ago. The set up was easy. The resolution is OK but if I had to recognize a face of a burgler from these videos, I am not sure that I could. I think it would only be good for a general description of a prowler. I was hoping I could read license plates on cars but it definately can not do that. That being said, I am satisified overall with the performance for the price that I paid.

Reviews.Title: Not Mac computer friendly at all
Reviews.Author: MyTooSense
Reviews.Content: Works with limited functionality on an iPad and IPod, when in local network. Gave up attempting to get it to work at all on my Mac computer

Reviews.Title: DVR OK but cameras are poor and documentation is only fair
Reviews.Author: D. Hull
Reviews.Content: This DVR is ok for the money. It pretty much works as advertised. The cameras that come with it are throw away junk, though. Ten feet away from the camera in adequate lighting you can not read 1 in. high text. I inquired about this and they told me how to set the camera focus. I was able to change the focus over a range of fuzzy to very fuzzy by opening the case of the camera, loosening a set screw and turning the lens housing.DVR Comments:- the email alarm delivery pretty much only works with gmail. I tried to get it to work with another smtp server that I use for my personal email and got a misspelled error message. The technician was no help other than "make sure you have your username and password right". I created a gmail account and that works. I never did get motion-detected alarms sent via email to work.- There are two UIs: one generated by the box that requires a connected monitor, and a web UI. Both remind me of work done about 20 years ago. You can get things done, but it's not intuitive. The DVR several times decided to lock me out of the box-generated UI which must be used for some things like setting the time/date.The supplied documentation is in small booklet form and includes screen shots that are unreadable black squares.On Windows,the web UI only supports IE. They do provide a separate application, though that seems to have similar functionality.I tried out the iPhone app and found it to be fairly rudimentary but it seems to mostly work though I found it froze up often enough that I probably won't use it much.If I can't solve the poor image quality this system is going back.

Reviews.Title: best for the price
Reviews.Author: steve
Reviews.Content: this system works as advertised night vision is nice and clear, day vision works good also.. this system works better than the cib system i first ordered but then sent it back cause the night vision was horrible... this system is really nice and works great,, do yourself a favor and buy this system

Reviews.Title: Works great on my Android phone!
Reviews.Author: ringwill
Reviews.Content: Good product for the price. Setup is a cinch for anyone with even a basic understanding of how to configure port forwarding on a home router. Running cable was most challenging part, but mobile/remote access setup is simple.Update: DVR is experiencing a reboot cycle, and freezes up constantly. Dvr is dying.  Product was set up in a well ventilated area, and never moved around. Hasn't even lasted 2 years. This is the second swann product that's died in less than two year, one at home and at work. Stay away from this model.

Reviews.Title: Low Cost Peace Of Mind
Reviews.Author: Glt68
Reviews.Content: For what I paid ($240), this is not a bad unit. I have a nicer system myself, and bought this to install at my girlfriends place. The DVR is a step up from some of the lower priced Swann units, the menus are easy to navigate and the ethernet setup is quick as long as you know how to forward ports in your router. We havent tried the smart phone viewer yet. The motion detection seems to work better than on previous models, on those you were either too sensitive or not sensitive enough. Swann seems to have figured it out on this model. The cameras, well, I am not so impressed there. The wider viewing angle is nice, but the night vision is seriously lacking. I have used Swann's lower priced BullDog camera in the past, and night vision is much better on it than it is on the Pro-550. The BullDog camera will stay in color mode at night if you have just medicore lighting, the Pro-550 goes to black and white mode even before the sun goes down. The down side of the wider viewing angle is that everything seems to be farther away than what it really is. If you are watching a large area it might be ok, but facial recognition is lacking from as little as 15 feet. After I ordered mine, the price of this set jumped up to around $399, I wouldnt pay that much for it, but at my $240 price, it seems to do the job.

Reviews.Title: Great Product for the money
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: I bought my swann surveillance system and it was "pretty" easy to get setup. The basic system just plugs in and works easily. The tricky part was getting it to work over my smartphone and pc.Hardest part of intallation was running wires. I bought a 500ft spool of rg-59 siamese. But the cords that come with this package are generous.This DVR does alot. More than what the average person will need. The cameras work as they describe. Check out videos on youtube to see what it will look like at night time so your expectations are not too high. The videos on the swann website really helped with getting the network set up. If you have a tech saavy friend that also helps.

Reviews.Title: Don't change date, if you don't want to erase your DVR!
Reviews.Author: pork eating crusader
Reviews.Content: For $250.00 Not a bad deal.However, after I captured loser tweeker property purp's I discovered my DVR date was not correct. So, I went to change it. Then, I went to review the loser tweeker's activies and discovered that everything was deleted! What REALLY disapointed me, #1. There is no warning on the menu screen that you are reformating your DVR. #2. Their so-called customer service that I waited for over 45 minutes WAS THE LEAST HELPFUL. #3. Basicly, Their instructions are not completely forthcoming. It is not a bad system. But you get what you PAY FOR!!!! Their customer service is counterdiction in terms. SET YOUR DATE UPON SETTING DVR! Camera's have a semi-wide angle field of view. Not the best, not the worst. Customer service is the worst!

Reviews.Title: Good, reliable, standard system.
Reviews.Author: Josh
Reviews.Content: At the time of this review, we ordered this video security system nearly a year ago and it's been working nicely with no issues, The hard drive is kept in a space that has temp extremes from 40ish F to 100ish F and it still works without any problems. The video is standard definition (no HD), and the more cameras you use, the smaller each resolution has to be or the fewer frames per second. But for the price I can't complain.

Reviews.Title: Not for IT illiterates.....
Reviews.Author: J. Baker
Reviews.Content: The hardware is fine, the manual is barely sufficient in terms of clarity in setting up the internet connections, DDNS, and email functions. They need to hire a good technical writer to flesh out the manual with step-by-step instructions so that you'd know what the behaviour of the system will be with each setting. And certainly need to develop instructions for the non-plug and play PnP user and the PPOe setup....don't just say these items are for experts... tell us how, illuminate,educate.11/5/2013 - have finally gotten the system fully set up on the bench (dining room table, anyway). The Android phone app works fine on the data network as well as local wireless so I know it works from outside the local network. PC access on the local network works and the remote admin console works like a charm. Had my son access from another city and the console worked there as well. This has been an education. There are a few things that the manual never mentions....like having to set up your router to always assign the same IP address to the DVR via association with the MAC address. I actually intend to use this system without a PC attached so have had to re-flash a Linksys WRT54 router with DD-WRT firmware to get some really neat functionality, like having the router maintain the DDNS update between the Dynamic IP your ISP provides and my chosen  DDNS provider's host URL I set up on their system (embedded Inadyn software in DD-WRT). Since I have a DSL modem that freezes occasionally and a seperate router, will be ordering a two port power cycler that will power cycle the modem and router if a ping shows a host to be unreachable. The only thing I haven't fully ironed out is whether the email alerts will calm down once the cameras are mounted. I can currently see some moire artifacting of the image while the camera lies on the table and suspect it sees that as motion. Sometimes I get lots of emails, sometimes just a couple, with only a few being true motion triggers.

Reviews.Title: windows
Reviews.Author: Joe Carlson
Reviews.Content: cant see through windows at night. but works great during the day. Like how I can look up the past 30 days

Reviews.Title: good system
Reviews.Author: Brad Webb
Reviews.Content: over a year now and still going strong. not the most hi tech system in the world but they get the job done and keep my employees honest.

Reviews.Title: Trouble focusing at night!!!
Reviews.Author: K. Lee
Reviews.Content: Based on the reviews, this seems like one of the better brands to get that isn't absurdly expensive.PROS:1)  It lets you watch your recordings at different speeds.  In addition, allows you to choose which recordings you want to review at a specific time and date.2)  Decent image quality when there is sufficient lighting.3)  The cameras that come with this unit are upgraded for better night vision4)  The night vision is better than expected.  If there's a street light in the shot or on the edge of the shot, the image gets a little washed out.5)  Great phone app.  VERY nice feature!  It helped with setting up the cameras which is a plus.  And I found it handy to just quickly check on the cameras before going to bed to make sure that they're still fine.CONS:1)  You cannot zoom in with the cameras.  It is just a basic camera.  You can (in a way) zoom in when viewing on the screen, but it is simply cropping the image and enlarging the existing image.  So it makes it difficult to make out any details if the person/object is > 10-15ft away.2)  Now that the region of interest has to be closer to the camera, you have to be careful that nothing is actually too close to it at night.  I tried hanging these cameras between the railings of my balcony with the front sticking out ~1.5 inches.  When I went to check on the recordings after it got dark, I noticed that nothing was in focus.  There has to be at the very least 2-3 inches of clearance on the sides and several inches in front or else the camera will have trouble focusing.  And this issue of focusing also includes window screens.  I tried propping one camera against a window and it was focusing fine during the day.  Once it got dark outside, the camera tried to focus on the screen and all I saw were whitish gray blobs.3)  These need to be screwed down.  The base of the cameras aren't heavy enough to balance out the cameras.4)  This might just be me, but I had issues watching the recordings.  I found it difficult to figure out the UI.  But once you figure out how to choose the date and time, it's easy to fast forward/rewind at different speeds.Overall, it's a decent product.  It's good when there is sufficient light or nothing nearby to interfere with it's ability to focus.  Just wasn't the right product for what I needed to use it for.

Reviews.Author: philip m ball
Reviews.Content: Had a bad camera.....took a while to get a response....and here is their disclaimer.....Conditions of Credit, Repair or Replacement  Goods returned outside 30 days of DOA period cannot be credited; we will repair or replace your stock only. Reviews.Title: Mostly fine so far, but tech support?
Reviews.Author: knoisy
Reviews.Content: I've had this system up and running a couple of weeks and am generally pleased.  The camera resolution is adequate and I'm impressed with the infrared capabilities provided by the built-in LED's.  I think the system was a bargain.  I have run into an irritating glitch, however, with the playback functions. I'm recording using motion-detection so in any given time period any or all of the 8 channels may have events recorded.  In principal, I should be able to review all 8 channels at once to check for anything noteworthy.  I've found, however, that when multiple channels are displayed on playback, many individual recorded events are skipped (i.e. not displayed when other channels are displaying recordings for the same time period). But the skipped recordings will display if you run the recordings in reverse!  The only way to be sure you're seeing all the material recorded for a given channel is to display only that channel on playback, a requirement that greatly increases the time necessary to review the recorded material.  I've email Swann tech support twice and received no response.  Maybe they're just slow.  I'll post updates to this review as the situation warrants.Post date: After a month, Swann tech support responded to my questions (misplaced my email, they said). They had me update my firmware - twice, because they initially sent me the wrong upgrade. The replay problem is unchanged, however.  If you buy this system DO NOT rely on multi-channel playback to review anything important. At least not without making very sure your system doesn't have the same defect as mine. They have not contacted me since I informed them that the firmware upgrade didn't work.  If they eventually provide a solution I'll post another update to this review.

Reviews.Title: Impressed
Reviews.Author: Amethyst
Reviews.Content: It's not a super high end Video System, but for the price I paid for it, it works well and seems reasonable. Install time for all cabling and DVR configuration was around 13 hours. I may have been able to do it quicker if I had done it before, but I'm pleased with the setup. I had it auto-reboot on me once, other than that, it records well, allows you to zoom into individual channels and playback is simple. Night vision isn't extremely far, however quality is reasonable, most everything in black shows up as white in the night. Good stuff. Thank you Swann!

Reviews.Title: Great System (EVEN when received WITH FAULTY EQUIPMENT)
Reviews.Author: adanf94
Reviews.Content: REVISION: (TEST EVERYTHING BEFORE YOU GET UP AND INSTALL THIS) I MEAN EVERYTHING. INCLUDING THE FOUR 60' CABLES THAT COME WITH IT! I RECEIVED A FAULTY CABLE AND now have to go back up into my attic and change the cables.First off, I'm not a very techy person, in order to to figure something out I use the trial and error method along with following written or spoken instructions. Make sure you really plan this out before actually ordering, by that I mean plan where the DVR will go (closest to a router) if you want to hook them up for over the internet viewing. Figure out where you will place the cameras, note the further you place them from where you want to capture the less crystal clear the picture will be, but you will get a wider view of everything around. This system does exactly what it says, if set up correctly. Again I say to plan out how you will attack this task because it will take hours if not planned out. I didn't think it needed much planning and my father and I spent about 5 hours running cables and setting it up. Remember this is a wired system so you will need to be able to have the wires run hidden or tacked to a wall, however you prefer. We chose to run them through the attic and drill holes from the outside in, in order to achieve the best position for the cameras. If you're shopping for a camera system and have the slightest bit of technical know how, this is the system for you.

Reviews.Title: The night vision is very poor.
Reviews.Author: Bryan
Reviews.Content: These cameras are rated for night vision up to 50 feet. Strictly speaking, you can make out certain objects at 50 feet, but they're mostly indistinguishable. I bought this camera in order to see the movements (not identity) of a person at 30 feet at night on a dimly lit street. At this distance watching the live feed you can identify a human form, but watching the playback from the dvr (on D1, the highest resolution) the person just looks like a pixelated blob. Very disappointing. I'm buying an ir illuminator to try to extend the camera's night vision range.

Reviews.Title: Good value
Reviews.Author: Mudslide Slim
Reviews.Content: I think the overall quality of the product is 3 stars, but I am giving it 4 stars because I think it is an excellent value for the price. Here are my impressions:Installation: If you can set up a computer, you can do this. Basically it is connecting the cameras with long cables to the DVR and power supplies. The DVR is then connected to your monitor or tv. VGA connection recommended for highest viewing video (not recording). Mounting the cameras and running the cables is no easy task and you want to get it right so plan ahead. It is a two day project for my house. I have not connected to the internet yet so no comment on that. I found the menus for setting up the DVR itself very easy and I had no problems navigating just using the supplied remote. The more you play with it the more comfortable you become. Even the owner's manual is informative and user friendly.Video quality:  There is a big difference between what you see live and what you see on a recording which is played back. The day live view is great although the wide-angle lens limits detail and is not great for all purposes. The night view is grainy but adequate. The recorded video when played back is much less impressive and lacks clarity. At night it is pixelated and hard to see any details. I am still playing with frame rates and resolution.Features: I think it is pretty user-friendly with adequate features. I am still trying to see how effective the motion sensing is so I can't comment yet. The DVR is compact and is noiseless, but the bright red flashing hard drive light is annoying at night, but I can tape that over. It is pretty easy to set desired parameters for each individual camera. You can search for an individual recorded event by date and time easily, but it has a what I consider a slow "fast forward" capability. The quality of the components are what you would expect for the price.Conclusion: Good value. Adequate for a basic security system with many features, but not high end and mediocre recorded video IMHO. The important issue is that just the sight of video cameras on a property is a deterrent to evil-doerFollow-up: After spending some time with this system I have to say I am pretty pleased with it. I think the folks at Swann gave this a lot of thought and came up with a good consumer product at a fair price. The motion detection feature is excellent and I was able to get better resolution on the recordings. It may not be an HD recording, but it is satisfactory for the price. High marks to their customer service. I had to call them to resolve a problem (of my own doing) and they walked me through it and were very courteous. If I had it to do over again I would probably opt for their higher resolution version, but I'm okay with this.

Reviews.Title: Updated after 9 months
Reviews.Author: jazzbabe2 "kitchen novice"
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the folks positive comments, after a lot of research, I purchased this system for it's wide angle cameras, reports on night vision quality, and night vision range.  Thanks to David from CO and his tech knowledge and willingness to help troubleshoot, I figured if I got stuck, I had a good resource out here.  At David's advice, I ordered the system and at the same time ordered 100 foot runs which we used.  My electrician put additional motion lights up and mounted two cameras.  The picture quality is very good; I still need to test the night vision recording for quality.  The menu driven setup is fairly intuitive.  We programmed to record on motion during the day, and steady recording after darkness.  We'll install another camera, and figure out how to connect wirelessly once we have the system running the way we want.  Also, we'll add a thumbdrive for more recording time, and see if we can get that working.  I am happy with this choice, after alot of research.  Update: 9 months later.  System works very well.  In fact, I will purchase another system since I am so satisfied with my own.  At my other property, my tenants had a bike stolen, and the 3 fam next door is full of degenerates, so I intend to purchase this system with 8 camera capability. I order with 4 cameras and purchase 4 dome cameras. I'm considering posting 12" bilingual warning signs "24 hour surveillance" since the system does not have an audible alarm to deter theft. One last comment:  People who are giving this system low grades imho are unrealistic or inexperienced. If you have 5K or more to spend, maybe you can do better.  For for 300-500 bucks, this system in unparalleled for it's quality, it's features, it's wide angle cameras, and it's night vision range.

Reviews.Title: Great Investment.
Reviews.Author: Whitney
Reviews.Content: Installation was fairly easy. I have a 2000 sq ft home and the cable provided was just enough. We have all 4 cameras up and running and have been using it for about a week now. I like that this system is sensitive to movement, ie: bugs flying past, trees moving in the distance, it even picked up when my neighbor came home across the street. (You can change the sensitivity on the cameras if you do not like that feature.) The night vision is great, I can still see with great clarity. The DVR and the monitor I have it hooked up to are working fine with no issues either. I have not connected the system to my phone yet so I cannot comment on that feature.We first purchased a Night Owl System and the night vision was like looking into a black pit, you could not see a thing. So we returned it and after reading reviews decided on this Swann system. For the money spent this system exceeds my expectations. I'm very pleased and would recommend it for home security and peace of mind.

Reviews.Title: Works out of the box - just make sure you have the right modem for remote viewing
Reviews.Author: Pabl8
Reviews.Content: The connecting up and getting going was really easy and it worked right out of the box.  I didn't have to use Swann support for this and there is plenty of information out there.  Getting the remote viewing working is where it gets tricky.  i spent two days trying to get this to work - learnt a lot about port forwarding, what my ISP will and won't do etc.  I had gone through every permuation and was kicking the dog, shouting at the wife and feeling pretty DIY challenged.  I'm reasonably technical.Finally decided to stop fighting my Belkin router, and went out and bought a netgear router.  The uPNP worked straight away, all the ports forwarded without me getting my hands dirty, and I feel like the DIY king.  Although I now know a lot about port forwarding which I can't use as the upnp on the Swann together with the netgear work seamlessly.Camera quality is great for the money, night viewing reasonable.  hey - for the money you're paying and what you're getting, this ain't no blu-ray show.  But it works and as the more detailed reviews provide, you're getting a decent piece of kit.  If youre more techie than me, good luck with the modem.  If not, save yourself the trouble and go with Netgear. I don't have a vested interest, just don't want anyone to share my wasted 2 days of fighting a modem!

Reviews.Title: Excellent price for a DVR and cameras of this price range
Reviews.Author: Griz44Mag "Griz44Mag"
Reviews.Content: As the instructions suggested, I plugged it all in on the kitchen table and tested everything before installing anything.  Right out of the box, it functioned perfectly.  After only 2 hours I installed the DVR on the desk, and the first two cameras.  The next night, the other 2 cameras.  The third night I set up the remote monitoring over the internet and installed the smartphone app.  It's awesome to be able to sit at my desk at work and watch the front door, the driveway, the back yard and the safe, all at the same time.  The instructions are easy to follow and very "to the point".  The picture quality is very good for inexpensive cameras, and the DVR functions perfectly all the way down to motion sensing and outside communication.  If you need a small inexpensive system, this is the one to pick.  The one thing that could be better, the cameras could use some more IR leds to provide more dead of night illumination.  Cameras are pretty chaep though, and a couple of them (outside ones) will get replaced sometime in the near future.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera System for the money
Reviews.Author: Matthew - IT Support Expert
Reviews.Content: This is the first camera system I have purchased and installed for my home.  Everything needed for installation was in the box, and the instructions were easy to follow.  I would recommend planning out where each camera will go and how to run the wires before you begin drilling holes in your house.Installing the 8 cameras took me about 4 hours total.I would also recommend having a dedicated monitor or HD TV connected to the DVR at all times - it makes making some changes much easier.My only minor complaint was with the manual - it really jumps around from one issue to another.  It would be helpful to have a more logical flow to the instructions on setting up the DVR.  I also had to call because I couldn't get the motion detection to record properly - they did answer the phone and the support tech was great.  He explained I needed to set up a schedule for recording (not mentioned in the manual).The Network installation was easy (but this is what I do) so I may be biased.The Adroid APP works great!  It is fun to see what the kids are up to when we are away.  It is also nice to know where our boys are playing outside without worrying.The Night vision is really good for a home system.  We have decent ambient light from street lights and security lights around the house.  However, one camera is in the dark and it still can detect and see someone from 40-50 ft away.  It may not be admissible in court but the video is good enough on that camera in the dark.I would recommend spending the money for the 8 camera system - even if you don't need all 8 installed you will have a spare or two.For some reason the internet based viewer is sort of grainy to view but it is acceptable.Finally, plan ahead, know your local laws on where cameras can be placed, and you should have no issues.

Reviews.Title: works well
Reviews.Author: DLK "Okiezeke"
Reviews.Content: I've had this system for over 6 mos. and have had no problems.  While the programming options will change or adjust any possible function, I was very happy to find that it worked right out of the box without having to find a 6 year old to set it up for me.  One of the cameras seemed to have a focus problem but turned out it was just slow.  Since I don't move cameras, it got focused and has been no problem.  Its been a good purchase and I really like it.

Reviews.Title: Economical but......
Reviews.Author: NYCLion "nyc_gotham"
Reviews.Content: A couple of things. Make sure that you know where you'll set this up (near a TV, PC, whatever)and that you can deal with running black coax to cam locations. Understand that smartphone apps will require a static IP address and your internet provider will probably charge you for that. Finally, the cams have limited flexibility. Up and down works fine but side to side ain't happening. I had to put a wooden shim behind one of the outside cams to get the correct angle.If there's a chance that you will need more than 4 cams, buy the 8 cam setup. The price differential should be less that the cost of separate cams.The physical setup was easy but I was working with a log home so running coax behind exposed beams was a piece of cake.I called the service number while trying to figure out the proper internet setup and my experience was great. Helpful and friendly. They run on Pacific time and they're closed Saturday and Friday evenings.All in all, a pretty good deal but they could have addressed the static IP when bragging about the smartphone feature.

Reviews.Title: My Review
Reviews.Author: Keithmj "Noodj"
Reviews.Content: Received the system and got it setup and working but not mounted yet, just playing with the system. The picture quality is not what I expected and you can tell who the person is in the video but I like it so far and should be happy with it and everything works as it should. I got it working without looking at the directions and didn't really have any problems setting it up. It is hard to write a good review unless you have used it for awhile so I will update later on. I also haven't hooked it up to the internet yet to view on my iphone so I don't know how that works but it doesn't seem to hard to figure out. I wonder what the video quality is on a better camera besides the 550 camera? Overall I would say that unless you expect a sharp clear image that you would be happy with this system, it does what it is suppose to.

Reviews.Title: Great Product!
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: Overview:Everything worked right out of the box with few minor issues. 1 of the 60 foot cables was faulty (connection bad, video went in and out). Cables are not too thin and not too thick but do note that the point where the cables split to power and video are very delicate and tear easily, I suggest putting electrical tape over these weak areas before running any wires. This however will happen with any camera cable, its not a quality issue with these cables. All cameras came working, and all infared bulbs work unlike some other brands. We only are having an issue with one of the cameras and thats only at night (for some reason the night vision on this camera is way too bright regardless of what you set brightness to) but this is a minor issue (UPDATE: 6/4/2012 We found out that it was because it was pointing at our pool and reflecting the IR light back into the camera lense...fixed by adjusting camera angle or moving camera farther away from the pool). Camera mounts and cameras are very durable, made of heavy black steel with adjustable sun shields. All cameras colors were right on for the most part, not bad enough to complain at all. Also, the night vision works great up to 30 or 35 feet I'd say, but having motion sensing lights on your house solves this problem anyways...a very little amount of light will make these cameras see very well (even street lights if close enough to your house). What I really love about these cameras is that the mounts can be turned and adjusted in ANY POSITION, no matter where you put the mount, you will always be able to move the camera so so picture is right side up and tilted the correct way! Many other camra mounts fail to achieve this, and are only mountable at certain angle...not these cameras, mount anywhere you want! The DVR hasnt had any problems, works great. Its quiet, runs pretty cool, and setting up remote access was easy with Swann's great customer service via live chat (with the ability to take control of your computer remotely to setup your DVR for you...live chat support avaiable on their website [...]). Was connected to support within 2 minutes (already contacted them 3 times, they have great service...people who said their support sucks probably tried calling them...its the 21st century people, using their chat support is much quicker). *NOTE: You MUST UPDATE the DVR FIRMWARE BEFORE REMOTE ACCESS WILL WORK, the DVR is not updated when you recieve it!!! (Swanns live chat support had the firmware updated for me within 10 minutes) The DVR menus are slick and smooth, and wireless mouses do work on this unit which is nice...the features of this DVR are way above what your paying, well worth it! This product is well worth the money and its upgradeable HDD and ability to add 4 more cameras is perfect. (Havent had problems with DVR resetting randomly like other reviewers said, however there is a setting in the DVR to have it auto reset on a schedule). The DVR (500 GB) will record for 2 weeks with 4 cameras on best quality or 1 week with 8 cameras...when they say above that you get 60 days or whatever, that's on lowest qulity recording, a little misleading but I warned you. It's no problem though as the hard drive is easily taken out and able to be replaced with a higher capacity HDD. I would reccomend this unit to anyone, the cameras are more than good for any home owner or business owner. Thanks Swann!

Reviews.Title: Works fine
Reviews.Author: MyShelle
Reviews.Content: We stupidly waited until something happened before buying a camera system (car got broken into in our driveway). It's clear, sensitive & we're happy with it. No other break-ins or attempted break-ins, probably because the cameras are visible once you get on the driveway.

Reviews.Title: Great customer support
Reviews.Author: LU
Reviews.Content: Pro:Low costEasy set upInternet/mobile access (with help of SWANN tech people via internet)Very clear within 15ft rangeCon:Basic system, don't expect anything useful beyond 30ftI had a very good experience with SWANN customer service. Easy to talk with them, and tech people helped me set up mobile access. If you want them to help you set up, please make a PC ready, which is in the same network with DVR, and also have your router login/password ready. They will remotely take over your PC and config your network to work.Three star product, Five star service.

Reviews.Title: Security Cameras
Reviews.Author: Jinger Howald "Jinger Howald"
Reviews.Content: Awesome security system for the home.  haven't figured out or had enough wifi to see the system on our smartphones but it does work at home.

Reviews.Title: Swann SWDVK 425504
Reviews.Author: Davalgee
Reviews.Content: Very easy to install and easy to use. Works especially well with my Iphone. Delivery was on time. I would definitely recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Great Security Setup For My Needs
Reviews.Author: John C. Griffin
Reviews.Content: I have seen quite a few issues with people complaining about customer support on Amazon for this product. I wanted to voice my opinion about my experience, which was quite the contrary. I used the online chat support system and while the tech support person was clearly Chinese, it had no effect on the quality of service, the friendliness of the technician, or the results she provided. I was having issues with setting up remote access as the documentation on this is admittedly sparse in the manual and online. Using a remote desktop solution the tech was able to change my network settings and port forwarding to allow me to access my home security cameras within a few minutes. On a personal note, I'm a little tired of the anti-Chinese sentiment some of the reviewers of this product, and many other product reviews on Amazon have stated. Globalization is a reality and to write something off as "Chinese junk" is ignorant and backwards.

Reviews.Title: Great product.
Reviews.Author: CM
Reviews.Content: As I have been looking for a system and read many reviews I had second guessed this product many times before purchasing. It is easy to install/hook up and easy to operate. If you want a nice security system this is it.

Reviews.Title: Great price, good features, easy to use
Reviews.Author: Mr.Snappy
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this camera and dvr setup for my business.  I didn't expect too much because of the price, but after a week of having it hooked up and recording I am pleasantly surprised.  The setup was fairly easy (the hardest part was running all the cables) and the DVR menu is easy to navigate and setup.  The night vision works, but the picture is a little grainy. They work well in a well lit area, and are fairly clear, best when something is within 10-15 feet further than that and they become a little out of focus.  For the price it is well worth it, especially for a small business and home use.  I haven't had any problems with them so far and they have been hooked up and recording for just over a week straight.  If you're looking for high quality video, you're going to have to pay for it, but these cameras are clear enough for me to make out facial features and clothing on people.  Would recommend for low cost protection.

Reviews.Title: An INCREDIBLE system for the price
Reviews.Author: E. Smith "EricGoBlue"
Reviews.Content: I read all of the reviews below and given some of the negatives, I was skeptical about purchasing this Swann system.  Wow, am I glad I gave it a try.  I am NOT someone connected with Swann or a retailer in any way.  The DVR and cameras were immediately plug and play - it couldn't have been simpler.  The resolution on the cameras was excellent and I was amazed at how the infrared allows you to see even in pitch black conditions.  Picture is color during the day and black and white at night.  One of the claimed problems below was difficulty in getting remote internet access to the DVR.  I have NO idea what the problem was with others - I connected with ease.  And my Droid phone found the Swann app quickly, loaded immediately and I was instantly viewing the cameras from my smartphone.  Again, why some people were struggling with this is beyond me as it couldn't have been easier.  Whether Swann customer service is any good or not, I haven't the slightest clue because I didn't need to call them for anything - - the system worked just as advertised and I couldn't be happier with this minimal investment.  I expected to pay double or triple the cost for what we received.  Absolutely happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Swann can see it all!
Reviews.Author: Derrick Johnson "DJ"
Reviews.Content: The Swann was easy to set up and use.  The cables to the cameras were long enough to reach all corners of my 2400 sqft home.  The video quality is great, could be a tad bit better, but not bad at all!  Setting it up via the internet for internet view is a little tricky (although I have not called the help desk yet.)  Comes with plenty of hard drive space for about 14 days of recordings or more!  Great unit for the price and you cannot find a more complete unit in this price range.

Reviews.Title: Great security setup for the price
Reviews.Author: Niliar
Reviews.Content: I bought this to augment the security of my rural home. My place is fairly isolated and a good 15 min from any police patrols. A standard security system like ADT offers would do me no good since the intruders would have plenty of time to take off with my stuff and flee into the woods. This system provides a good deterrent to potential thieves. The cameras, while small, are still quite visible from a distance.Setup took me approximately 4.5 hours from opening the box to doing the final checks on the feeds. The supplied 60 foot cords were more than long enough for my mid size two level home. The hardest part of the install was crawling around the attic running the cables. Once connected, the cameras all worked flawlessly.The picture quality during the day is quite good and night views are clear. The box states up to 50' range at night but I would say its more like 30', which is perfectly acceptable for my application. When installing the cameras, be sure to avoid having too much of the wall visible as this will create a bright infrared reflection and greatly diminish the range and brightness of the rest of the view.The manufacturer provides their own mobile viewing applications, however like other reviewers, I had trouble getting this to work. I downloaded IP Cam Viewer and had it setup in under 2 minutes.My one complaint is the lack of Mac support for viewing the feeds on a computer. The manufacturer has provided a plugin that is supposed to allow you to view it with Safari, but I was never able to get anything other than a network error message. I was able to use the provided NetView application as well as Internet Explorer to view the feeds running Windows 7 in Parallels. Not a perfect solution but it works.Overall I am satisfied with the purchase and would recommend this to anyone looking for a basic, well priced camera system.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good system for small office or home...lots of features
Reviews.Author: Michael "Michael"
Reviews.Content: I had to come back and re-write my review (and upgrade it to 5-stars from 3-stars) after having these cameras for a couple of weeks.  The whole system is pretty good.  Initially I was having some difficulty with poor camera performance at night.  But I figured out one of them was being blinded at night by the reflection of the IR LEDs right back at the camera.  I relocated it slightly to move it further from the white surface it was close to and the picture at night was much improved.I finally got a second camera wired up and added and noticed its picture was significantly better than the first camera.  I tweaked the camera settings on the first camera and bingo!  Picture on both was outstanding.Setting up access to the recorder on my network was the easiest I've ever seen.  I've had a lot of wifi cams and helped co-workers with similar DVRs to the Swann unit, but this one was by far the smoothest to set up.  Mobile access is good on my Android phone and I'm very pleased.The ability to set specific areas of the field of view of each camera to detect motion is fantastic.  The "alarms" are good, and it definitely emails out screen captures when it detects motion.  I had to set it up to use Gmail (which Swann recommends) as the SMTP server...I was never able to get it to work with my Comcast account.One other useful thing I discovered is that the camera mounts are a perfect match to the threaded portion on most floodlight fixtures.  I unscrewed the mounting base that came with the camera and threaded it into one of the empty positions on my floodlight fixtures already on the house.  Made for a very professional look and was easy to mount...no drilling required.

Reviews.Title: For all future buyers: you cannot focus on these cameras, poor resolution
Reviews.Author: Hongjin Huang
Reviews.Content: I wish I had known this earlier! We bought the camera and hired contractors put them up (took 2 days!), then we noticed all pictures are fuzzy. I read the whole manual but did not find any information. Contacted Swann, was told you have to open the camera, there is a tiny screw that you need to loose, then focus. this is IMPOSSIBLE to perform!Then they told me I can purchase the 360 camera at $300 a piece.I think they intentionally hide the part of focus issue, once you purchase the system, you either live with a poor resolution camera, or you have to upgrade at your own expense!

Reviews.Title: swann security system
Reviews.Author: F. E. Belluso
Reviews.Content: installation was straight forward.....all camera's working just fine.....the remote unit is a piece of junk...when you pushon a button most of the time it stays in.. have to retract the button with your finger ... the manual is not written well..and the pictures in the manual are very dark not good at all.......i think they used a copy machine to print out the manual.the video is great... im using a monitor to receive the pictures......to program the receiver is a pain in the butt....overall i like the unit......

Reviews.Title: Great system.
Reviews.Author: M. Varley "flyfishnh12003"
Reviews.Content: So far so good.  I had this system up and running now for about 4 months.  I bought this as a deterant to neighbors who think my property is theirs.  So far it is working.  I bought a pack of extra long cable because I knew the 60' cable that come with it would not get me their.  I have most of my cameras on the second floor line of my house and all on the exterior.  One camera when installing got stripped out, so be careful when tightening the large holding nut down, I fixed it by tapping a new hole with a larger screw.  The interface is fine, not big worries about it ( I have not set up the internet connection yet).  I ran it to a central location and put it in a cabinet with a lock on the door and a fan in the cabinet to keep things vented.  I am happy with this purchase and hope I will never have to use it to is full reason.

Reviews.Title: meh could be way better..
Reviews.Author: Matt the Photographer
Reviews.Content: i can never keep this thing working.  the web portion doesnt work. the cameras are good. i think ill try and get a new recording unit to use with the cameras as this one is pretty useless.

Reviews.Title: It was very stable and easy to install
Reviews.Author: C. Morrissey "Campbell"
Reviews.Content: I bought this when my father was ill and dying.  It really was a life saver and made me feel comfortable when I couldn't be with him.  It was very stable and easy to install.  The price was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for an extra set of eyes if you have home health cater or a wandering disabled person at home.
Reviews.Author: laura a wallace
Reviews.Content: The only reason its not 5 star is the cameras are not as flexible in setting up on the target as they should be. they are jointed to aim up and down but lacking in a side to side adjustment which limits target positioning. Overall best night vision I have seen. (and that's at night on a farm...very dark.) It is easy to review footage. I initially purchased because I have a household member with Alzhiemers who tends to wander at times. I can now observe him outside and still give him privacy. If he were to wander at night I can see what he is wearing and which direction to look. I am very happy with the 8 camera system and am considering an indoor system to keep up with caregivers when the time comes. I am concerned about medicine being given appropriatey and treatment of my loved one when I am working. My mind will be eased if I can monitor from work. I have also set the motion alarm. Of anyone walks by a camera the monitor beeps and the camera affectAffected goes full screen on the monitor if he is outside i know exactly how he is moving. :)

Reviews.Title: Great Security System for the cost.  Works great.
Reviews.Author: Josh
Reviews.Content: For the money i dont know if you would be able to find a better system.Install is very easy like people have said.  Hardest part is running the cables.The mobile phone viewing is a little tricky to get set up but one call to there service/tech support got it sorted out in about 10 min.Have now purchased one for my house and an 8 camera system for my business.

Reviews.Title: decent value. expect to spend sone tome with customer service though
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The UI needs a bit more clarification. Customer service is only during business hours. Picture is nice. But the ir will reflect off of glass and wash out any images from through a window at night

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Manny Llera
Reviews.Content: This cameras are great. They are easy to install and the view is good. Customer service is great; they help you out.

Reviews.Title: Very nice Product
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: Before making this purchase I read reviews on all the products offered on Amazon. I had several questions and posted those. Amazed at how helpful and quick other reviewers responded to my questions.  Product arrived very quickly.  Very easy to set-up and the quality is outstanding.  I haven't had to use their customer service/support, so unable to comment about that. This is a very high quality product, the images are great especially at night.  Using the product in a vacant home that is being rehabbed.  Made sure neighbors know that a video system is in place and haven't had one issue with unwanted visitors. For vacant property, this system combined with a quality cell based alarm system sure gets the word out that the home is secure.  Very pleased with the product and thanks so much to the Amazon Reviewers who helped so much with providing input and feedback so I could make an informed purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great Manufacture
Reviews.Author: Casteela
Reviews.Content: The Swann product is one of the best manufactured security system around. But if you don't get a install card with it, then you can't get it professionally installed. If your a tech wiz then you wont have no problems setting up the unit to your TV or monitor.  Mounting and wires are a breeze to install.

Reviews.Title: Great product! Great price!
Reviews.Author: Corey
Reviews.Content: Great system. Cameras are sharp and clear during daytime. Night time viewing is also good. A little difficult getting it set up to view on my phone but a few calls to customer service and now I can view my cameras on my phone.

Reviews.Title: Great system at a great price.
Reviews.Author: naporter
Reviews.Content: Comes with everything you need to get started, however be aware that if you have to put a camera a good ways away from the DVR, consider getting extra long cables.  The internet viewing worked well, however it did have a catch, it required two different apps, one for viewing when you're on the same network as the DVR, and one for when you're on a different one.  Little confused about why, but oh well.  Not a whole lot of need for viewing it on my phone at home when I can just walk into the other room at look at the monitor.

Reviews.Title: Good for home use
Reviews.Author: Jon
Reviews.Content: These aren't amazing. They work pretty well for what they do though. Mine came with the 640 tv line cameras and a note saying it was a free upgrade (Amazon name said 530, box said 600, actually got 640), I assume they do this for everyone though. I ran one camera a week because my attic is a terrible place to be. Still have two more to run. So far they have been good. My main complaint is the interface. All of them. The DVR interface, mobile version, and web version. Heads up for the mobile version, you have to use the admin account and the first 6 digits of your admin password. I also had to get more cabling but I wont knock it off for that, I needed longer runs. I'm also going to spray mine with insecticide some time because spiders apparently love these things. I have to brush off webs about once a week. The night vision on them is ok but not spectacular. I bought some solar lights and a flood light that has a low setting to help with that.
