It's a good camera system but not what I was hoping. If you want a super high end system with 1080p video and such, expect to pay 4 times as much. If you get good lighting, this system will be perfectly fine I think. Just an extra layer of security.

Reviews.Title: Crazy good deal - great system - love it
Reviews.Author: M. Jones
Reviews.Content: Got the system all installed and all the remote access working.  Amazing system.  Wiring takes forever - but it is what it is.  I just did mine ghetto style and ran the cabling out the cable hole in the wall and strung it up the wall and under my eaves.  Took me id say about 12 hrs+.  For the internet setup I had to manually forward the ports on my linksys wireless router wrt54gs.  The router says it has upnp which I enabled - but it just didnt work.  The phone apps work although over wifi at my house its slow.  If you have only one or two camera views up it helps alot and is delayed but works pretty good.  I leave the system on motion all the time.  Its really sensitive - but thats a good thing.  You can mask off visible area and dial down sensitivity which does help.  But inevitably a bug will fly right into the lens at night or a spider will weave webs all over the camera and set it off.  The quality id say looks about 4x better than video quality you see in stores - its pretty good.  Id say you can make out a face mostly at about 6ish feet.  The color for me was very good.  I saw others complaining about having to adjust it.  Mine was perfect and needed no adjustment at all.  The email snap shots are pretty low quality and no way to make better.  Also they may or may not catch person triggering motion.  Nevertheless, still nice to know when the cameras are tripping.  The remote management interface is absolutely awesome.  Its better than managing from the dvr itself. You need good web bandwidth to make it workable - but over wifi at home its very very good.  I can live view and also - check cameras for recordings its super sweet.  I can see when my girlfriend gets home and leaves and when the dog goes outside to go bathroom.  I can see spiders making webs, bugs flying at night.  All the cars driving by my house.  Its very cool and works really well.  Very Very impressive for the money.  I showed all my friends and they were very impressed.  Overall I really like the fact I can see what is going on around my house.  In the end I think it just makes you feel safer because you realize probably 99.99% of the time your house is boring. Nothing going on.  Also knowing whose in front of your house at night.  You realize its just walkers and people passing through haha nothing to worry about.  Overall - I give very high marks for this system its amazing for the money.  Beware though I inquired into install costs and got quotes of around $2k for camera systems for 4HD installed, or from electrician to wire and estimating 2k plus!!!  It took a long time to do it myself ghetto style - but the cost - ZERO - haha.  I highly recommend buying 150 foot cabling separately.  The included 60 foot cabling is not very long once you realize you have to go up walls and around things to wire up.  I just took excess cabling and wound it up near the camera and tied it up.  Didn't notice much if any quality difference in 60 foot vs 150 feet cabling to the cameras - didn't seem to make much difference.  Good luck with your system.Other details:At times the system gets stuck recording motion when there is none a reboot fixes it. (not often)Also, sometimes the system gets stuck sending email snapshots from a camera where nothing is happening - again a reboot fixes. (not often)On the networking setup:I followed example in manual for gmail - worked perfectly.For internet - as above I mentioned I had to forward ports manually through router - on linksys WRT54GS you just access 192.168.1.1 from your web to get access to the router - also - when fwding ports manually from router - you have to specify IP of DVR - so I configured dvr to be static IP even though my local network is DHCP - I figured worst case I would get a conflict and notice and reset the router - no big deal.  So far no issues whatsoever - set DVR to 192.168.1.7.  I have cox cable internet - they basically give me a static public IP (on a normal account - they might change later but i wont care - ill just redo setup) - if you look up [...] it tells you your public IP.  So after ports are forwarded - you should be able to remotely access the dvr by opening 192.168.1.X:85 (in IE - after following IE setup for security settings mentioned in the manual) where X is what you gave the dvr.  This will open the dvr on your local network.  This should work even if you didn't get your ports forwarded properly I believe.  Next step is to test if you can access the dvr through your public IP - to do this - just supplant 192.168.1.X with your public IP.  If all is well - you will have the web interface come up.  For me this was very slow compared to local network access (via wifi but still a ton faster than public IP).  Also, follow the manually instructions on how to change the security settings so Internet Explorer can run the ActiveX scripts.  If this works - then the phone app SwannView will most likely work for certain - except they use a different port for phone - as long as you forwarded the ports mentioned in the manual you should be fine.  Its helpful to know that if you can access it locally on your net first - it will help to debug the public IP part (this is not explained in the manual).  If your public IP changes then you will have to do deal with the DNS thing - which I didn't bother with - so I can't help there - but it's just another layer over what you will have already setup.  Hope this helps.  Good luck!

Reviews.Title: Would not buy this for my home
Reviews.Author: marc from Florida
Reviews.Content: I have installed three of these now for friends that want inexpensive systems in their home/business. The installation, wire running and camera mounting typically go smoothly but when it comes to setting up the software, usernames and passwords I have found it difficult. Every time I have had to call tech support and have them set it up for me. They are typically nice but it has taken them from 30-120 minutes each time.When it comes to the iPhone app, it does work, but you are not able to login with separate usernames. Only the admin login is used. Which means if you only want friends and family viewing certain cameras, bedroom for instance, you are unable to.The first system that I installed about two years ago is no longer able to be viewed online. It just won't work anymore, I am however still receiving alerts from the motion detection... I have not called tech support about the problem as of yet.

Reviews.Title: Want a great security system?  This is it.
Reviews.Author: David Miller "dqdave"
Reviews.Content: Easy to set up.  Wonderful support.  Has a iphone app called "swanview" that links to this system giving me to watch my business anywhere in this world.  I would not hesitate to buy it again.

Reviews.Title: very good cameras pnp feature did not work for me
Reviews.Author: Kenechi C.
Reviews.Content: i bought the swann system for my brother to used in Nigeria . i first tested it here, very impressed with the  cameras especially the night vision capability. there was a note in the box that the camera was upgraded. the reason for the 3 star is because I could not get the remote viewing to work after following the step by step introductions.I call tech support and after an hour the ask me to call my ISP.

Reviews.Title: love them
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Chevalier
Reviews.Content: ive had them for a while now they work good took a lil time to figure out night vision but once we did its great ive finally caught the kids and u wouldnt beleive the thing u see while ur away. the nice and clear recordings

Reviews.Title: It was a great price
Reviews.Author: Jerry J Lambert
Reviews.Content: I have installed 3 of the 4 cameras so far.  One of them provides a blurry image and apparently, I cannot focus it as it appears to be a prefocused camera.  The instructions could be a little clearer in exactly the steps needed to set it up.  I was finally able to set it up to do what I wanted to after reading and re-reading.  Still have not tackled the "internet" portion of the system.  It sounds very complicated.

Reviews.Title: Very Good Equipment
Reviews.Author: Mario Alberto Flores "Mario Flores"
Reviews.Content: The Swann SWDVK-425504 S 4 channel is a very top quality item. It is easy to install and set up. The video output quality is very clear.I would highly recommend this product to anyone in the market for surveillance equipment.

Reviews.Title: Works great on TV, Computer and cell phone
Reviews.Author: Sharon Bottomlee
Reviews.Content: Got this for my birthday July 6, I set everything up to see that it was working properly.  My husband ran the cable in attic.  We connected everything again and it worked great.  I did install the netviewer and playback that was on the disk that was included with the cameras and dvr.  The nice people at swann port forwarded my ips  on my dlink so I could see the cameras on my cell phone.  They have a free dns service which I am using because my external ip would change often.  Don't be intimidated.  Read the instructions, watch a few videos on youtube and the nice people at Swann will help you with the rest.  I turned 61 this year and this is one of the best birthday presents I have ever received.  Love watching my grandkids in the yard.  Thank you Swann.

Reviews.Title: Great video recorder.
Reviews.Author: Ray562
Reviews.Content: I like this video recorder because you can view whats going on even without being there.The cameras are good  cameras and can see very good at night.

Reviews.Title: Worth It
Reviews.Author: phinsfan78
Reviews.Content: I've had this system for 6 months. And hasn't disappointed. The customer service was awesome. I have the app on my phone. And I don't miss anything. If you are wanting to keep a eye on things. This system will do the job.

Reviews.Title: Worth it for the price
Reviews.Author: Kenneth
Reviews.Content: Not bad unit for the price, altho the reviews about the color switching on and off were correct altho I find that is when it becomes dark and the camera have to use night vision. I am still having trouble accessing the cameras remotely , but Im sure I will eventually figure it our. Overall I was happy with my purchase

Reviews.Title: Awesome product
Reviews.Author: Gary
Reviews.Content: Once it is install, all systems are a go! I love my system! It gives me piece of mind while traveling.

Reviews.Title: works
Reviews.Author: Blake Paff
Reviews.Content: It was pretty easy to hook up once you got everything out of the box and layed out in front of you.  The mobile was easy to hook up, but it quit working after about a week.  Idk.

Reviews.Title: Price is good, camera is good but options, features & Tech support poor
Reviews.Author: mack
Reviews.Content: I thought these would be great, features seemed great but after installation and setting up the network it was a pain, this has to be hard wired which really sucks. I called tech support several times and got the run around and hung up on because they dont know what they are doing and give wrong information.I got one tech a female with Asian accent that said you can use USB wireless which does not work, spoke to another fem tech which said no it has to be wired modem to attach to it so go return get another and guess what still does not work.. The operating system takes time to learn and get use to, its not hard but really a joke how much it takes to do one thing to setup,Still trying to get this thing setup on modem, the tech support is pretty worthless so far.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Big C
Reviews.Content: This is a great product and a good value.  It does exactly what it was designed to do.  Tech support was excellent.  They set up my remote access.  I can now monitor my house from anywhere.  Night vision only works well with sufficient lighting, but I expected that.

Reviews.Title: keep your thieves honest....
Reviews.Author: Kevin H.
Reviews.Content: you could spend a fortune on security systems and management for it, WHY?  this system is an all-in-one ready to go, right out of the box system. it takes a bit of common sense to run cables etc. but once they're ran, it is SET IT AND FORGET IT.*HINT* i called Swann immediately after getting all cameras set up, where and how i wanted them, they remotely took over through my pc and did all the diagnostics for me and set it all up for me, including setting up my emails and alarms and everything. they were quit kind about doing it too, maybe i got lucky, but it sure took out all the confusion and i didn't even have to read the instructions then. now i have peace of mind when i am away from home.

Reviews.Title: Excellent customer service from Swann
Reviews.Author: Shopper
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product in November, 2012 and found it easy to install and get online.  After three months, one of the cameras stopped working at night.  I called Swann Communications and they quickly advised me of the return procedure and assigned me a return voucher number.  The entire customer service and return process was one of the best that I have ever experienced in my life.

Reviews.Title: Great Security System
Reviews.Author: Dora Hall
Reviews.Content: I love this security system. I love the ability to select which cameras and times you wish to record and that you can view and record from offsite.

Reviews.Title: Nice system
Reviews.Author: Michael Shaw
Reviews.Content: This has turned out to be a great security system. Has a lot of great easy to use features and was pretty easy to set up out of the box. It also has a pretty decent recording time.

Reviews.Title: Business Security
Reviews.Author: Namatia Stinnett
Reviews.Content: Bought this for better protection and security. This product actually was simple to hook up and quality of viewing is clear. I love it and the price is just the icing on the cake for me.You must get this if home or business security is important to you.

Reviews.Title: Piece of mind
Reviews.Author: Marty
Reviews.Content: The camera quality wasn't as great as I was hoping for when paying 400+ for something. I know it's not a fancy super hd camera that cost 3,000 dollars but I was hoping for a bit more when spending 400+. The night vision works well but the quality is a little grainy. It is a nice bundle though, you get everything you need and everything worked well right out of the box. I had called technical support and chatted with them online and they were super helpful. I bought this mostly to monitor my house and animals while away at work or out. I had to have the support person take over my computer to set up the remote viewing but it works great! I can keep an eye on my property and animals and that is what I wanted most out of this. I leave it recording for days and days and never fill up the 500g hd. I don't save old footage so I just reformat the hd and have my 500g (more like 478g) back in a few seconds. I would recommend this for monitoring but if you really need to identify cars plates and faces at night you are gonna have to drop a lot more money to get better quality.

Reviews.Title: Satisfied!
Reviews.Author: Tim
Reviews.Content: We purchased this because we wanted to keep an eye on a property from a far. Cameras are very good with day and night vision very clear. Installation was super easy, "plug and go" however I read reviews prior to purchasing and others expressed concerns on getting everything hooked up and "in network".I am NOT a technically intelligent person and after giving it one go I called SWAN helpline, 15 min later the did it all over the phone. Incredible efficent help team that were experts in walking me through entire set up and network.  This is by far the reason i rated them a 5 star.Today we have 4 camera system with live feed I receive on IPhone, IPad, and my computer. We also get email alerts with motion detector.Overall very satisfied and actually looking to purchase more for my office.

Reviews.Title: OK Security Camera System
Reviews.Author: J. O. Neil
Reviews.Content: This is my second system and this one is OK. During the day, it records very good quality video, but at night it is a different story. Some cameras are completley useless while others are very dark and you really can't see much with out a light on. I wanted this system so I could view my home from work during the day and it works great. Since I'm home at night, the fact that the video quality is poor doesn't bother me. If you want this for night time, I wouldn't buy it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Customer Service
Reviews.Author: Todd Fahrenthold
Reviews.Content: I had bought this DVR as a replacement for a Clover one that failed. All I needed help with was the remote access over the internet. I telephoned Swann and reached a tech that walked me through the entire set up on the router, PC, iPad and Android phone. Everything works as advertised and we're very happy. We still need to setup the email notifications, but we're positive Swann can help us if we get stuck.

Reviews.Title: Not worth the money
Reviews.Author: bravo0163
Reviews.Content: Angle of view is too narrow no matter how high you go. Mounting screws strip easily, camera base is very small, hard to mount on hard surface without hitting camera or stripping screws. Customer Service was helpful though, you may have to call them to get into the menu to change settings. I couldn't access the menu after my 2nd try because of a vga setting. Go with a higher video line rating than 480. The picture is OK during the day but the IR picture at night is terrible!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Security Camera System
Reviews.Author: Amazon Shopper
Reviews.Content: This system does EVERYTHING AS ADVERTISED. It comes with 8 cameras, a 500GB DVR, remote control unit, mouse, and all electrical connectors/wires/plugs required to connect everything. The cameras are perfect size (not too big and not too small) and they provide excellent picture quality during the day and good picture quality to within 15-20 feet with dim lighting at night.There are (4) four ways to manage, view, and/or monitor the DVR: (1) At the console itself. (2) Using the remote control unit (3) Using a computer on your LAN/WAN (with the Swann PC Software installed) (4) Using a Mobile Device such as a Blackberry Smartphone, PDA, etc... I tested all four methods and all worked quite well. The hardest part of the setting this secuirty system up was configuring the router to ensure connectivity using a mobile device over the 3G network or a PC on a WAN. The Swann instructions are not that good - in part because there are so many mobile devices on the market. However, I was able to figure everything out on my own without a call to Swann Customer Support.I documented exactly how to connect a Blackberry 9370 Smartphone to the DVR over the 3G Network but Amazon.com would not allow me to publish the website address of this instruction page as part of my review. Therefore, I can't even tell you the website address to go to.  However, the most important part is ensuring that UPnP is enabled on the DVR itself and that "Port Forwarding" is properly configured on your router to process TCP/UDP packets. Swann Customer Support can assist you if you do not have basic networking knowledge (Private IP Address vs Public IP Address, Port IDs, port forwarding, packet types, etc...).The bottom line is that this system does EVERYTHING that it says it does. The Swann instructions are not that good but you should be able to connect everything if you have basic knoweledge of how to connect and operate a standard DVD recorder. I still give this product 5 stars -- especially for a security camera system for under $400. It is excellent.

Reviews.Title: easy setup
Reviews.Author: Michael C
Reviews.Content: This surevilaance saytem was easy to set up and get running.  I have no issues on month out of the box.

Reviews.Title: Easy enough
Reviews.Author: John Palazzo
Reviews.Content: I found the basic set up easy enough. Resolution is good. I still have not hooked it up to the internet so no comment on how easy that is or isn't. If you want to hide the DVR away from sight but still view on a TV somewhere else you will need to get a longer RCA to BNC cable than the one that comes with it. You do need a clear line of sight in order to use the remote to the DVR.

Reviews.Title: works well
Reviews.Author: barrie
Reviews.Content: works well easy to set up but the alarm is of no use all and if like me you need to be alerted that some one is leaving or coming

Reviews.Title: Good cameras and nice controller for the money
Reviews.Author: dave
Reviews.Content: A little hazy on night view due to internal illuminators on cameras, but overall a nice kit, instructions are adequate, but not detailed and software is adequate. recording quality could be better,but is definitely a good home or small business starter package.Installation and setup are pretty easy.Order larger camera or additional illuminators for serious outdoor night vision usage.

Reviews.Title: Happy with it
Reviews.Author: Kristin The Boss
Reviews.Content: I bought this to put around our house and thought this one looked like what I needed. I wanted something with a good name but not a huge company since I am really careful about my privacy rights. It is easy to install, not crawling in our attic, but hooking it all up was  sort of plug and play. This works great in day light and great at night, where we have little to no street lights. It can be set to record or just motion recording. The box holds a lot of data and the remote is pretty easy to use. The only trouble I am having, still, is setting up the internet app on my phone to the box, but I will continue to work on that. I am really happy with how user friendly this is and how well it works once all set up. I would highly recommend this unit.

Reviews.Title: Great system, great value, great customer service
Reviews.Author: M.M. Michelman
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this to anyone looking for a inexpensive security camera system.  I was amazed by how much you get for the money. The Mobile access is the best part.  I have a an Apple AirPort Extreme router and was having trouble setting it up. I called customer service and they walked me through the entire setup. They also were able to remote in to my computer to complete the setup. I didn't even talk to anyone, I used the the online chat service.  Everything works great.  No complaints.Just a few notes:-Previous computer/basic network understanding helps. If you don't have that get a friend who does.-plan your install...put your cameras in locations and make sure the views are what you want before running cables. Also make sure you can achieve the cable path you want.-use the mouse that comes with the unit. It is much easier than using the remote.-if you can spend the money, get the 8 camera unit even if you don't have a current use. Once you start to use this you will want more cameras.-get some longer cables (sold on amazon) better to have the extra cable if you need it-have patience, this isn't a one day job if you do it yourself.-Test everything before you start

Reviews.Title: Great Security System
Reviews.Author: Rosebud Marketing Group "Thom"
Reviews.Content: I read several reviews before purchasing this security set and  was greatly influenced by the reviews I read. I have now purchased and installed my security system and can confirm that all of the positive feed back  I read was correct.  Installation was simple, everything works fine.  Customer Service was a delight.  The only reason I did not give five stars is because they sent very cheap screws that prolonged the installation.  As soon as I purchased better screws I was finished very quickly.

Reviews.Title: Security Camera Review
Reviews.Author: Canawupass
Reviews.Content: This stystem really is plug & play, set up was a breeze, purchased extra cables as I wanted to locate the cameras quite a way from the DVD, clarity is good, access through my cell phone is easy and it is not bad in low light conditions. For the price it's a deal.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: ARKcomputers
Reviews.Content: While researching a security camera system I saved at least $100 from the other sites offering this same product. It's capability, versatility and clarity of media is well worth the price. Ease of installation is fantastic. One 'con'; you must have an account (monthly fee) to view from your smart phone using DDNS.

Reviews.Title: A good system but tech support ??
Reviews.Author: Bayou Country
Reviews.Content: I've had this system 825504 for awhile, works great, dependable.  My system works great with no freezes on phone or internet.  However, I've set up my brothers system same as mine, he has freezes on phone & internet.  I've tried to contact tech but its been a week now, no response.  So you decide if tech support is important, they lack there.  I rated it a 4 star for that reason.  Their video support is pretty good, but if you do all that & still have problems you may be on your own.

Reviews.Title: Manager
Reviews.Author: CCA
Reviews.Content: Excellent product easy to set up and also easy to talk to someone "LIVE"  to help when you need help.  Installation is very easy. Can view from a smartphone which is very nice.  Yes I would definately recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Great unit for the price
Reviews.Author: Sal
Reviews.Content: I bought this unit not expecting much, but it is a really great unit for the price.I did not hook up to the internet yet but I'm sure it will not be an issue we can't get over if needed.The cameras have already been exposed to rain and snow and no problems.If you need a camera with a wide angle get one because the cameras are basically straight forward.Very easy to install, I was quoted prices of $6,000.00 and lower to install an 8 camera system and I got it done with $1,300.00 total.

Reviews.Title: Securing your home
Reviews.Author: Patos
Reviews.Content: This is a very good system.  The daytime aspect is excellent but the nighttime visual is less impressive.  Easy to setup on your own with the exception of the Internet viewing.  Manual deficient in this regard.

Reviews.Title: Zero stars would be better!
Reviews.Author: T. Hollingsworth
Reviews.Content: I will never buy a Swann product again. About a month after the short one year warranty ran out, the DVR went bad. I chatted with their tech support for nearly two hours as they tried to find out why the front controls, mouse and remote stopped working to bring up the menu. Finally, they had me put in a new hard drive that I had handy to rule that out as bad. It turns out the DVR died already. What horrible quality

Reviews.Title: no customer service
Reviews.Author: morris schiller
Reviews.Content: I have been trying to get a hold of somebody at the company for a while now and nobody is getting back to me.

Reviews.Title: Horrible Customer Service
Reviews.Author: larryhat "larryhat"
Reviews.Content: I bought my unit late November 2011.  I needed/still need help on a couple of things, but you can not get these guys to return a call.  The main customer service is answered by what I believe is an India call center, after waiting on hold for 50 minutes the person I talked to was hard to understand and no help at all.  She was going to have the English speaking tech to call me back the next day.  That was November, mid January....still no call.  Also, they give you 65' of wire which is good if you live in a 1 bedroom apartment.  Another thing, they are closed on Saturday.  Camera is pretty clear, but I would check to see another company that may have better service.

Reviews.Title: I Have Swann DVR Working With Airport Extreme !
Reviews.Author: Diane C. Taylor
Reviews.Content: 12/15/2011Purchased the Swann DVR with (4) 550 cameras. Quality is great for the price. Changed one camera to a Swann 690 PTZ. Tech support DOES NOT EXIST !!Gave up trying to port forward, and other suggestions for the AE from net. Decided to try to run the much easier Upnp idea. Solution in my case was to set the Airport Extreme to run in "bridge mode". (Yes, there are downsides)Next, I had to access the DSL router thru my LAN to find the internal IP. I set the DSL router to pass Upnp.Of course, had to go to [...] to find out the public IP.I can reach the DVR from home or away on PC / Iphone. Even sends e-mail when DVR has any alarms.One problem I found is that the DVR can only send alarm e-mails to ONE account. Since I can set up multiple users, I was surprised to find this problem. My solution was to now "share" that one e-mail address among the users. Came to these solutions after many hours of trying different ideas.

Reviews.Title: Inexpensive, Easy To Use, Worth Getting
Reviews.Author: Rob R.
Reviews.Content: I have several of the more expensive Panasonic POE cams. I got these because the whole set of four, with DVR, is half the price I paid for each of the Panasonic cams... they also have night vision, but lack pan, tilt and zoom. The Swann cams are very easy to install, set up, and use.  I did not even read the manual at all... it simply worked. I was easily able to view the cams within Internet Explorer and via the client software provided by Swann.  I do not suggest that people even bother installing any software on a PC, just use IE.  I have the system hard wired to my home LAN and that worked just by plugging it in.  I have not yet been able to view the cams from over the internet outside my home, but I plan on getting that up and running next.  I did try to download the viewer on my Blackberry, but Swann does not seem to support my model of BB yet.  There is no sound.  The video is average, but not sharp.  Night vision works a bit, but only in a very limited area.  So far it has only been running one day, so I don't have a lot to say yet.  But I do wish I got the model with 8 cams instead of only 4.  Not to have four more of these model cameras, rather, to add some better/more cams on to the 8 cam DVR.  Definitely worth the price.UPDATE:I am easily able to view the cams on my iPad and also outside my home.  I still believe this is worth the price.  I recently upgraded to a 16 camera professional model DVR though... not because there is anything wrong with this model, rather, because I needed more than 4 cams.  In fact, if anyone wants my old one, minus the hard drive and cameras, I'd be happy to give it to them for FREE.  Just send me a message here, you can pay for shipping, and I'll give it to you free.

Reviews.Title: DIY is possible
Reviews.Author: silversurfer
Reviews.Content: This product is very good for the ease of setup  for the control of the cameras the remote setup for the internet is not a plug and play. experience is a must for a home instillation, and camera location may take pro help for running wire.

Reviews.Title: Online Home Security Purchases = Annoying (never ending!) Sales Calls
Reviews.Author: YD5
Reviews.Content: The system has been tested but not set up yet. The equipment appears to work great (the infrared is surprisingly clear) and I'm happy with the general clarity of the video. However, the reason why this is a 2 star product rather than 5 star is because of what I have been dealing with ever since I made this online purchase.I purchased this security system through Amazon because the price was great. Fry's sold the same system but for a little more (~$30-45) so it just made more sense to buy it online. Somehow my phone number was leaked and I have had at least two or more sales calls a day (trying to sell me home security equipment) for the last 5 months! At first, the calls would have real people on the other line and I could nicely request them to take me off their list, but now the calls are all recordings! It's so frustrating!!!If I had to do it again, I would buy my security system at a store with cash so there's no record of me purchasing home security equipment. I am utterly disappointed that an Amazon vendor would let this happen. The consequences of constant sales calls (even on the weekends) completely derails the purchase of this equipment through Amazon.

Reviews.Title: made in China
Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: One camera didn't work right out of the box. Another one doesn't switch over to see at night. Not Impressed.

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased With This System
Reviews.Author: MWCraft
Reviews.Content: I bought this for home use about 2 1/2 months ago after several unlocked cars in my neighborhood were been "broken into" and had change stolen out of their ashtrays.  We figured it was neighborhood kids due to the things that were not stolen -- i.e., one guy left his wallet (containing cash and credit cards) on his front seat but they only took the change in his ashtray.The included instructions were minimal but clear and had plenty of color pictures to guide you thru setting up the cameras (which you really could figure out without the manual.)The first thing I did with this was swap out the 500 GB hardrive that it include with a 2 TB Western Digital Green drive I bought at the local Best Buy.  That was just as easy as opening a desktop computer and swapping out a drive plus, it greatly extends the amount of video you retain before old video gets overwritten.I added 4 more cameras and have the system recording 24/7, except for a weekly automated reboot).  It took about 9 weeks before my initial video was overwritten.It has an on screen menu that allows you to setup up each camera, motion detection, alerts, etc. according to your preferences.  I figured that out without instructions but it would have been nice to have a comprehensive, full color manual that explained things in a little more depth.I did not try connecting this to the Internet and configuring it for smart phone viewing so, I can not speak to the ease or efficiency of that process.  Besides, why would you want the NSA looking at video of your house? :)The most time consuming part of the install, was running the wires from the cameras to the dvr.  I looked up "how to fish wire" and "how to install security cameras" videos on YouTube and that armed me with enough information to tackle those tasks.This is the first dvr system I have owned/worked with so, I cannot compare it to other systems.  Nevertheless, it has functioned reliably for me and more than fulfilled my expectations.

Reviews.Title: good product and good customer service
Reviews.Author: Dana Knott
Reviews.Content: We ordered this and werent sure what to expect for the price.  I installed all cameras and hooked everything up in 9 hours.  We had one camera go bad but they sent another one right out at no cost.  The hard part is getting the thing set up to view from another computer.  It took two phone calls to customer service but they took over our computer and ported and fixed everything to make it work.  You have to be an IT guru to do it on your own.  The customer service has been great.  I can watch my house from work, live.  For the money, I was very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Great System!
Reviews.Author: Valarie M. Jones
Reviews.Content: Purchased because neighborhood kids were entering my gated back yard. System came within days of ordering.  I LOVE IT!!  Immediately opened and set-up (without mounting) to make sure everything was working properly, and it was.  Played around with it for several weeks to become familiar with features.  There are sooo many I didn't realize it had.  Called 800 number for assistance with setting up on the internet and iphone.  Staff was very knowledgable and set up everything for me.  Cameras aren't crystal clear but are more than ok.  Infared works best with some outside light.  All in all, VERY pleased.  Would definitely recommend.  As a matter of fact I already have!

Reviews.Title: Not bad for the money
Reviews.Author: Shelter Dawg
Reviews.Content: I spent some time researching entry level quality DVR's and this is what I ended up buying. The cameras are kinda cheap and clunky and have the "convienence store" quality video, but its a lot cheaper than a IP camera. It would be nice if the cameras were white to match the soffits on 90% of the houses out there but I suppose you can always paint them. The setup within the DVR is clunky as well but it works. I would like to have seen a mobile app that would let you change some of the settings remotely but not yet. The key to remote viewing is to have a uPNP router, so much easier than port forwarding. Swann also offers a free DDNS service which gives you a dedicated domain and IP address. So far the DDNS service has been pretty reliable. The length of the cables are about 60 ft and I bought some longer cables for cameras further away. You can configure each camera individually. I have some cameras with motion detection turned on when I'm away. You can set up active zones for the motion detection so if a car drives by or the dog walks by it wont trigger an alarm. The alarm email function sends a picture of the "motion " it detected. The instructions give examples for Gmail accounts but any email provider can be used. The only other thought I can make is that you need to leave yourself plenty of time for running cables. Give yourself at least an hour for each camera and take your time. The DVR should be hidden but accessible so that you can easily make changes to the alarm schedule.I've only had this running for about a week and will update if I get any new information.

Reviews.Title: In this day and age, it is good to have the surveillance cameras
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Product installation went okay, although pulling the wires through the attic crawlspace was hot, dirty work, that would be the same for any wired system.  The cameras were a bit difficult to mount until we purchased, separately, brackets that mounted more easily under the eaves.  After a few months, the DVR broke down for no apparent reason.  Swann replaced it with minimal hassle.The video quality is adequate, not thrilling.  Happily for us, the most interesting things it records are the raccoons and skunks and possums and deer who visit in the middle of the night quite regularly, as opposed to porch pirates and burglars.  We did nail a local man who had the bad manners to bring his dog onto the front lawn to do its business.  I posted images from the recording to let him know that we knew, and that took care of the problem.We had some tricky time getting the sensitivity adjusted so the motion sensor does what it should do, instead of reacting to leaves blowing in the breeze.  Spiders sometimes make webs over the camera lights that confuse the sensor.We never did get the Internet connection so that we can see the DVR when away from home.  We think it is the firewall doing what it is supposed to do, which is to keep people out.After some discussion, we set the recognition area to omit monitoring of the street or the neighbor's curb, and monitor only our own yard and driveway.  Our neighbor asked us whether we had caught an image of a suspicious person that he noticed, but we did not.  If we change that decision, we can easily alter the area to see more of the street.

Reviews.Title: intermediate loss of picture
Reviews.Author: Cheryl Peterson
Reviews.Content: I use this system with a combination of the Swann IR cameras and some lower profile  cameras. I've used it for about 10 months now. While reviewing footage I get a blank screen on one or two of the cameras.  There seems to be no rhyme or reason.  The blank outs seem to last for about 30-60 seconds and it happens randomly on different cameras and different times. I also  get blank outs while reviewing on a ffwd or fast rewind but the picture sometimes comes back if I press normal speed.  It's maddening! The fast review only goes up to 16x normal speed which consumes much more time for reviewing (my other security dvr does 32x and offers snapshots which is more efficient).It took a while to figure out how to make programing changes- it is easy to exit without hitting the "apply" option (I lost some important recording because of this). The time on the clock seems to wander a minute or so a week but my other dvr does that too. Downloading to thumb drive can only happen in  predetermined segments of time.  I have mine set to 30 minutes but often my "event" crosses over 2 segments. Example: I have an event from 10:48 to 11:02 so I have to download one full hour worth (2- 30 min segments) to capture14 minutes on video.  The download time is surprisingly long. 2-3 minutes for each 30 minute batch.One thing I will do differently on my next purchase is upgrade to more memory.  Depending on how many cameras there are the old footage gets written over.  Sometimes I don't even know to review an event until weeks later and it is already gone.

Reviews.Title: Great video quality
Reviews.Author: Thomas Pain
Reviews.Content: Set this up in a few hours. It has great video quality - night vision is exceptional. Only downside would be that they are fairly narrow in area. Great for covering entrances and exits - if you wanted to cover the entire front yard a broader view camera would be needed.

Reviews.Title: Swann 4-Channel DVR W/Smartphone
Reviews.Author: paul odell
Reviews.Content: Great basic system. I have ordered more higher resolution  cameras and cable. I would recommend to anyone buying the 4-channel dvr system to consider the 8-channel instead even if you don't need the extra cameras. I bought the 4 and should have bought the 8. I now have to either start over or add another 4-channel. You cant beat Swann tech support. Had trouble getting the video feed to come up on my phone, called tech support, they walked me thru it, emailed me the instructions for later use and a done deal.

Reviews.Title: Hard to set up on your own
Reviews.Author: Dale C
Reviews.Content: I initially set it up with moderate difficulty but spent too much time with tech support afterwards not realizing I was done. Spent 2+ hours with tech support trying to figure out why it wouldn't work. They saw it was working on their end and couldn't figure out why it wasn't linking to my phone app properly.Found out that you have to connect to a different IP address to view it on the app if you're connected to the SAME wifi modem as the receiver. The seperate wifi IP lets you view the cameras on your phone if you're on the same wifi but you have to change the channels to connect to a different IP when you're out of the wifi and using the 3g/4g on your phone or wifi from a different router.

Reviews.Title: Decent basic Security DVR for the money
Reviews.Author: B. Brindle
Reviews.Content: This system works pretty well and I've been pleased with it. It supports Android and iOS devices for remote viewing. Has a decent Mac client and works good with MS IE on the windows machines. Favorite features of the unit are ability to download captures via the web interface easily, motion detection that works very well along with a log that takes you to the motion events when viewing them on the DVR itself. Cameras are OK up close but pretty low quality at a distance. The cameras work good at night with IR illumination and seem to hold up well in the weather.

Reviews.Title: Great camera set up with mobile viewing option
Reviews.Author: MaryannR
Reviews.Content: This system works quite well. The set up for mobile viewing did take a call to customer service for me to figure it out, but that's because I'm not an IT nerd. I did get frustrated trying to get thru to "tech support" so on my third try (after waiting way too long on hold) I pressed the button for something else (like sales dept or something) which my call was answered quite promptly (I'm sure because they thought I was going to buy some extra product or something) after explaining how long I've been on hold a number of times for tech support, and that if I didn't get someone to help me immediately I would have to return the product, I got right thru (go figure). That's the only reason I can't give it 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Very nice system.
Reviews.Author: dcalvin
Reviews.Content: I've owned my camera system for several months now with great results. 100 degree heat to zero weather with no problems. Easy to set up and nice picture also.

Reviews.Title: I do recommend it
Reviews.Author: Manuel Nasser Perez "manuel"
Reviews.Content: Product received and was as expected. I already installed it in my house over a year ago and I am satisfied with it. All cameras have worked perfectly. I do recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great system
Reviews.Author: Joseph P Curry
Reviews.Content: I read all the different review on many systems. I purchased this one and then purchased an additional 4 camera's. Easy to install.There is a small issue using a Droid with their app but search for it and you will find the easy solution. You need proper nighttime lighting around your house. If you think a $500 system will give you 300 ft IR you need to look elsewhere.I would buy again from SWANN. Follow the normal security procedures. Cut trees, bushes down. Install nighttime lighting.I have the dvr hooked to a monitor and then purchased an rca spliter amplifier and ran the out video to 3 TV's.. Love checking on the house while not there.

Reviews.Title: Good System - Super Customer Service
Reviews.Author: Edie Diaz
Reviews.Content: This was really pretty easy to install. We were able to set up almost all of it ourselves. For the one item that we needed help on, their customer service was super. They could work remotely to finish up the Smartphone issue. They also assign an account number for you for future reference. These folks really believe in customer service. Picture quality is good. They even upgraded the cameras when sending the order to us. The night vision is really clear as well. If you want a household system, this is it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Franncisco Tamarez
Reviews.Content: Excellent product, I am very sastifecho with him. I recommend it to anyone interested. It is very use full for every one

Reviews.Title: Very Satisfied Customer
Reviews.Author: JRay52
Reviews.Content: The system arrived before I expected it.  It was well packaged.  Everything I expected was in the box.  It was easy to install setup and we are now using it exactly as planned.  Very happy with the product, delivery and this entire transaction!

Reviews.Title: Lot for the money
Reviews.Author: james
Reviews.Content: Had this system for a year now for the money a good deal. could be clearer on the resolution. two three of the eight images have developed a slight blip or distortion I see every now and then

Reviews.Title: Swann Rocks - this unit is great value/performance
Reviews.Author: SF Bay Guy "SF Bay Guy"
Reviews.Content: Works great!  I have been experimenting with several different makes and BAR NONE, Swann has the BEST customer support.  I am super technical/network savvy, but even the DNS setting can be a bit daunting.  Swann (with your permission) temporarily logs into your networked pc, configures router, dvr etc and helps with quick setup.  Smart phone app is better than others (lorex, q-see) but opt for higher quality cameras (can be changed).

Reviews.Title: Easy viewing and good for screening parking lot
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Purchased for a church.  Works great for screening the out buildings late at night.  Easy viewing from home or anywhere. Can view from tablet or PC

Reviews.Title: Perfect right out of the box.  Easy set up if you have some computer skills.
Reviews.Author: VoraciousReader
Reviews.Content: Everything you need was in the box.  It all worked as advertised.  If you need help, their tech support can set it all up for you remotely at no charge.

Reviews.Title: Legit
Reviews.Author: aj
Reviews.Content: This company is legit. Im an I.T. guy who does everything for the company involving anything electronic. Setup was simple and smooth. Cameras arent the best of quality but im sure the price for this product told you that.They could improve on giving detailed descriptions for settings, when first getting the system online, for the people who arent in I.T., but thats just words on improving the already decent system, plus for the price, your most likely not going to find better.This company is located in the USA,UK, Australia, Hong Kong, and Canada. That alone should let you know you cant go wrong buying their product.

Reviews.Title: Nice system
Reviews.Author: Dustin Vaughan
Reviews.Content: I'm no expert on security systems by no means ,but from what I can tell this seems to be a pretty decent system. The only problem is the distance. Once your about 15 feet away it gets pretty hard to make out a persons face. But overall good system for the money

Reviews.Title: Video Recording System
Reviews.Author: Ricky Gandy
Reviews.Content: This is a great system for the money.Easy to install.Settings are easily adjustable.Can be reformatted.And decent picture quality

Reviews.Title: Great Value, Easy to Set Up
Reviews.Author: Tiffany blanchet
Reviews.Content: Bought these for home security after vandals threw a rock in my front window. These were easy to set up and access. Great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: Easy to set up and a bang for your buck.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I purchased another DVR surveillance system from ZMODO; and I just could not get the router settings right.  Mind you that I am tech savvy.  So I got frustrated after calling their tech support waited forever to talk to someone and just gave up and returned it.  I logged onto my amazon account and found Swann had the best tech support and the reviews said it was easier to set up.Upon receipt of the system, I went straight to setting up the router and remote access.  With the UnPnP it was a breeze compared to what I was dealing with before.  It took me all but 30 mins to configure the remote access and cell phone (android phone) viewing.Setting up the cameras is a bit of a pain.  You need to dedicate time and energy on this effort to make sure that you have the cameras in the right spot and cable length can be an issue so plan on that too.  You might need the help of someone else when doing this which is my suggestion.  After about 1/2 day of planning this out and running the wires in a hot attic space I got it all homerun to the DVR and that was it.  I logged on to the DVR and set the motion detection settings and I was up and running.  The remote log in is quirky because it is linux based but read the manual carefully and do exactly what is says.  Also internet explorer is REQUIRED when you do the remote log in via PC (Firefox, Chrome will not work - I tried).  PLEASE FOLLOW STEP BY STEP on the settings if not you are hosed and will get frustrated.I ended up having to return 1 of the cameras because of focus issues.  It was a breeze too.  Swann has excellent customer service and tech support.I would highly recommend Swann products to anyone.  I ended up buying another 2 different types of cameras to augment my system and it was a breeze to add on and setup (1 of which was a Pan Tilt (no zoom)).  I can't say anything else but good things.If you need an easy to set up system and also need tech support, then Swann is the product for you.Happy shopping.

Reviews.Title: Great product but have to call for setup
Reviews.Author: Peter Kim
Reviews.Content: Great product but it should clearly state on the instructions to change the Video System for me to NTSC if the default doesn't work.  Also, to call customer support for help with the online setup. I was able to call customer support and they completed the setup for me online via remote connection but it should state this in the instructions as a normal person couldn't have set it up for online viewing.

Reviews.Title: Nice entry level camera system
Reviews.Author: dogpile
Reviews.Content: This was quick and easy to setup. Had to make some config changes to my firewall so that I would use the mobile application, but it was a breeze. The cameras were all plug and play and the user interface was easy to follow.

Reviews.Title: great product
Reviews.Author: Christopher Kindelspire
Reviews.Content: Works great for an analog video system,  options are good, used in a commercial application easy to install still haven't had a change to setup for remote web viewing.

Reviews.Title: Nice but the Internet viewing isn't easy.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Good value. Everything went up easy. The menus are nice with a lot  of options. The tech support is great. I still don't have the Internet viewing working but it's looking like my Internet service provider is what's holding me up.

Reviews.Title: swann cameras
Reviews.Author: S. Rahaman

Reviews.Title: Good Home Security System for the money!
Reviews.Author: Papa Smurf
Reviews.Content: I decided to upgrade my old 4-camera slow-mo VCR based system to the DVR system.  When it was all said and done, I only used the existing wires to the 4 cameras.  My old cameras were shot, I didn't even know it (10 years old).  I only used the old system when we went on trips.  Anyhow, I now have 8 cameras up and running covering the back along with the front of the house.  The system runs all the time now, so no worrying with trips.  I have it set up on the network which did require running a cable to the wireless router.  So, I can view the cameras from my laptop via the network.  I can also view the system from the internet, when away, using the same software on my laptop.  You should be able to view the cameras from a smartphone, but I have not done that.  You don't really need a monitor on the actual dvr once you have the network setup.  There are some settings you can not get to without being at the dvr during the initial setup.  You will need to know or be able to figure out some networking issues but they supposedly have a tech support line to help.  I never had to call them!Update - 9/16/2013  Just found that the DVR was not recording.  Called customer service for Swann, very nice but some communications issues!  Sending unit back for replacement cost me $18 to send back, not happy about that.  Hope the next one lasts more than 2 months.  The problem I have with this unit, is it gave no indication it was not recording.  I have the unit hidden for security issues and without seeing the red HDD light not blinking, you don't know.  I was viewing via the Intranet and nothing alarmed me to the failure.  I just tried to pull up some old video and found it!  Right now I would down grade to 4 stars, if the next one doesn't last I will change it then!

Reviews.Title: Poor Customer Service
Reviews.Author: luv2horsetrain "luv2horsetrain"
Reviews.Content: Overall decent product for the money.  Very easy to install and system worked great for 6 months until recently when one of the cameras failed.  I expect technology to fail and so I wasn't upset until I worked with their customer service team.  Initial call went well but I had to climb up 20feet in the air and disconnect cables to test for the tech and then disconnect the system to provide various pieces of information which was unpleasant but expected.  Camera started working and Swann provided a ticket number and indicated that eveything was documented in the event the issue ocurred again - it did about 2 weeks later.  This time previous solutions did not work and when Swann was contacted again there wasn't any notes in my record even though they found the ticket number.  Customer service representative was very very difficult to understand and wouldn't stray from script and kept repeating the same thing over and over again.  Finally after going up the ladder again and tearing apart the system to provide the same information again they agreed to replace the camera as long as I paid to ship it back to them.  No urgency on their part which was odd since it is a security system and installed for a reason........they acted as if I was having issues with a personal digital camera and could go without the use of the product for a few weeks.  Again, good system for money and user friendly just simply very poor customer service!!

Reviews.Title: Works OK, but horribly insecure for a security product.
Reviews.Author: Jack Daniel
Reviews.Content: TL;DR version: works great as long as you don't care at all about the security of network access.The system simply works, right out of the box- I installed and connected the cameras to the DVR, powered everything up and everything just worked.  I was thrilled.  The IR function of the cameras is pretty feeble, but that is as advertised.Then I tried to connect remotely and discovered that the system's network connectivity is pure garbage- web access is via Internet Explorer only, because it has to load an ugly plugin, it doesn't support any form of secure login, the system even had Telnet open.  Swan goes to great lengths a few places to encourage strong passwords, but since the login is via HTTP the credentials are sent in cleartext so they can easily be captured.  Further, they encourage the use of UPnP, and that has proven to be a bad idea so many times in the past decade I am baffled by it.  The web/network access stuff is from the 1990s at best.

Reviews.Title: Can't get online to work.
Reviews.Author: Shmeg McGee
Reviews.Content: As a standalone unit it's great and does it's job.  Here are the pros and cons as I see them.Pros:Cameras look clean and crisp on the screen.  Frame rate is smooth.You can output to VGA AND Composite so multiple viewing stations are possibleWill record only in motion areas that you select.Easy to use GUICons:Rewind feature isn't that fast.  If I have to search through a whole 24 hour period it takes 1.5 hours at the fastest setting (16x)The unit restarts for no reason every now and then.  Not a big deal but it also resets the output to VGA.  I have to manually make the menu appear on the composite output so I can see the menu (when using the mouse) on the composite monitors.  When the unit resets it puts the menu back on VGA.  This causes me to have to plug a VGA monitor in so I can put the menu BACK on the composite monitors.I still cannot get the remote viewing to work.  I'm sure a few hours of online tutorials will help me out with that.All in all, these problems all seem to be solvable.  I can always get a VGA-Composite adapter to avoid the reset issue.  Just wanted to let everyone know about these little things.If anyone knows how to make the swannview app work on the iphone let me know :)  I have knowledge of how to port forward, etc.

Three days after installing the system, we have someone take some lumber that was purchased for a job.  The whole action was caught on video and the police loved the image quality.  It was simple to download the video to my PC from the dvr and burn a CD for the police.  We were able to identify one of the two people and the other is expected to be identified soon.Well worth the money and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Email feature less than satisfactory
Reviews.Author: Mack Hucks
Reviews.Content: The point that I would like to share about this product is the email feature. The triggers that cause the email alert is NOT captured. The image that is emailed is about 30-45 seconds after the trigger. For instance - if someone was to break into your home, it would not email you the person breaking in. You would see an image of after the person was in. I have contacted support several times about this and there is no resolution. You can search in the recording to find the event as it will have recorded. Out of the 100 or so emails that I receive a day, there is not any reason for the event in the captured image. This causes my rating to be low. If this defect was corrected, I would give 5 stars.Swann's support leaves much to be desired.

Reviews.Title: Nice DVR
Reviews.Author: Jeanie Jacks "JJ"
Reviews.Content: Happy I bought this 8 channel DVR, because I ended up purchasing 2 additional higher resolution Swann cameras (Swann SWPRO-760CAM-US Pro-760 Super Wide-Angle Camera and Swann SWPRO-750CAM-US Pro-750 Pan Tilt Zoom Camera with 3x Optical Zoom).  The DVR is compact and light weight. It has built in PTZ settings which is convenient. Connected to my Samsung HD TV via VGA cable, and the pictures are nice.  I am not a techie but found this extremely easy to set up.  Easy password setting, camera programming - motion detection etc. On screen displays, use a USB mouse or the remote control. You can customize each camera setting, when you want to record, level of sensitivity, and if you only want to record upon motion detection. I set up email alerts to my smartphone Google account. The email comes with a nice snapshot of whatever caused the motion detection (only selected 2 cameras so as not to get too many emails!). I like that you can select what areas of the camera view you want to allow motion triggered recording.  Nice playback pictures. Works well with Swann smart phone app (android). Allows up to 3 users to access cameras at the very same time. The app also allows password setting, which adds a layer of security.  I have recommended this product to a relative who is interested in purchasing a new DVR.

Reviews.Title: Starter level cameras only
Reviews.Author: S. Gallo "Tia Pita"
Reviews.Content: This is a starter kit only.The description of these cameras are misleading and the picture used in this ad is a fabrication of the truth. Thepicture shows the inside of a car roughly 5-10 ft away. I've used these cameras around my house to catch various wildlife which has been digging up my garden and beyond 15ft you can barely make out the outline of the animal. Human faces are completely indistinguishable from beyond 15ft at night.The cameras at this level are good during the day. I can make out a human face from around 50-60ft. Beyond 65ft it gets a little difficult to see details. We are planning on purchasing several higher level cameras from Swann to cover longer distances. These cameras (the 550's) are only going to be used at the front and back door.The installation was easy enough; the camera have several screws you can loosen to adjust the yawn, pitch and roll of the camera. The rain shield is adjustable forward or backward. The cables are good enough to each several important areas on one side of the house, but I had to order several cable extensions to cover the other side.I find the menu system easy to use, but the searching for "motion alarm" can be quite tedious. Any moth which fly in front of the camera will set it off. My event log is usually loaded with 200 events each evening, making it a long time before you actually see what set it off.The HD is small, only 500 meg, I already put in a 2 tera drive to increase the storage.I've yet to set it up on the internet and use the software to view from my phone, but from other reviews I expect it to be suitable for what I need.

Reviews.Title: Cheap, but leaves a lot to be desired
Reviews.Author: arnold haan
Reviews.Content: Interface is non-intuitive.  The Remote Control SUCKS!  I mean it honestly SUCKS!  Missing pivitol navagtion buttons especially a "back" or "exit" button to get out of interface controls easily.  You literally just get stuck in settings sub screens.Web interface and RGB interface are very different, and don't need to be.  Major design flaw.The cables that come off the camera, the extension cables they send, as well as the 100 ft and 150 ft cables are CHEAP.  The extended cables don't have the color coding of the packaged cables.  The gauge of the wiring and cheap cheap cheap sheilding make it easy to pull apart and break the cables while wiring the house.  The extended cables will also take you about an hour a piece to unwind, and that's if you're careful.  They wouldn't even take the time to properly spool these 100 and 150 ft cables.  Again - CHEAP.The brackets that hold the cameras have very little flexibility.  Mostly caused by a lack of joints, and or/ joints that are too short to adjust.  The camera sheild actually hits the mounting bracket and limits ability to point the camera.Camera's also suck.  No zoom functionality is a joke.Swann's web site is USELESS for support.  you can read the manual you get in the box, but that's it.  Try looking for a forum or FAQ on their site.  Search for Default IP Port number, or remote access and you get zippo, nada, zero results.You get what you pay for.  8 camera's and a dvr that has internet access, web interface and mobile interface are nice.  but corners are cut everywhere else.

You decide.  I made my decision, and returned the system unopened.  Buyer beware!
